Job Title: Earn $100,000+: a real solution to reopening restaurants
Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


About:
We are a startup looking to form partnerships with restaurant consultants who can help sign up restaurants for our 100% free service. Our founders are from Airbnb and Google. 

Cheqout is a free contactless mobile ordering and payments solution. It essentially turns every customer‚Äôs phone into a personal kiosk that sends orders and payments to restaurants‚Äô POS systems. We provide QR code placards to place on tables or outside restaurants. Customers pull out their phone camera, scan the code, and this opens the restaurant‚Äôs menu on our mobile website, where customers can order and pay. Cheqout is not an app, so it works with any phone. 

This means customers no longer have to touch a credit card reader, touch a menu, wait in line, or even wait for a waiter. They just scan the QR code (wherever you place it inside or outside the restaurant) and they can order and pay. 

Cheqout is 100% free for restaurants, and we can set it up at any restaurant in less than an hour.  

Our Referral Program:
We are offering to share profits 50/50 for 12 months for every restaurant you can help us sign up. 

To get started, please Apply Here.

Other questions? Reply to this listing and we will be happy to discuss.

compensation: 50% profit share for every signed up restaurant

PHYSICAL DEMANDS
Employee may be required to do the following: climbing into and out of equipment; reaching in all directions, handling and manipulating objects and materials; coordinating the movements of eyes, hands, fingers and feet to operate tools and equipment; lifting up to 50 pounds from ground level, waist level, and/or overhead; carrying objects, tools, equipment, etc.; standing; sitting; walking; pushing; pulling; bending; kneeling; crouching/squatting; crawling; seeing with or without correction; hearing with or without correction. MENTAL DEMANDS

WORK ENVIRONMENT

The individual who occupies this position must not pose a direct threat to the health or safety of such individual or others in the workplace. This means the individual must not pose a significant risk of substantial harm to the health or safety of the individual or others that cannot be eliminated or reduced by reasonable accommodation.

We get asked "what's the catch" all the time? There is no catch. Our customer base demands the best service and pays for this service, so we need the best drivers and we pay for the best drivers.

We are expanding and looking for drivers that want a permanent home.
Are you looking to be treated with respect?
Not wanting to work for a huge company where you call in with a number instead of a name?
THERE IS A REASON WHY OUR DRIVER TURN OVER IS SO LOW.
If this interests you, please read on...

A little about us first.
We are a family owned business that was founded in 1959 and we are looking for drivers that want to join our trucking family. We are financially stable; you will not have to worry about your paycheck bouncing. You will talk to a knowledgeable dispatcher on a daily basis that knows who you are down to your favorite football team. If you have any suggestions, we would love to hear about them. In short, we care what you have to say.

Normal runs are out 7 to10 days with most, but not all, resets at home.
Our typical runs are west of the Mississippi with our focus on the Western 11 states.
Assigned trucks, NO SLIP SEATING.
Tractors are I-Shift (you will not have to shift a truck again)



Additional Benefits:

401K plan with company match from day one
Paid on all stops
Cell Phone paid stipend
Birthday gift and Christmas Gift
Vacation and quarterly bonuses
Trucks governed at 70MPH

We will be honest with you and not promise the world to get you hired then change what we promised. We have plenty of work for motivated individuals.





303-761-3195 ext 323

Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


***MUST HAVE A MIN. OF 3 YEARS CDL A EXPERIENCE AND COMFORTABLE DRIVING A MANUAL TRUCK***

Truck driving is one of the most important jobs in our nation. Without your help, people would not have food on their table for dinner at the end of the day. You are the backbone of our economy, thank you.

We are a family owned and operated transport company that is looking for a OTR driver with a CDL class 'A'. Since we're a small company and we only have a handful of trucks we're looking for a Partner in our company that can do a pre trip correctly, make sure our vehicle maintains DOT standards, and takes care of our equipment as if it were their own. You must be comfortable driving a 53 foot trailer and driving in but not limited to within the midwest, south east, and north east regions of the US.

*Candidate must be comfortable driving stick shift*

Responsibilities: 
We look for honest and responsible on the road delivering freight entrusted with 100% accuracy.

You MUST have positive attitude and ability to overcome daily challenges.

Driving one, two or three days to different destinations, (will be assigned a route) able to drive long distances within the US.

Expertly maneuver a 53 foot trailer and semi truck OTR into loading or unloading positions.

Collect and verify delivery instructions running the temp according to the delivery bill of lading.

Inspect vehicles for mechanical items and safety issues and perform preventative maintenance.

Report defects, accidents or violations on a pre-trip and post-trip inspection.

Must be able to work few evening shifts, also needs to be very good with attention to details
Communication with us is critical.

Staying in communication with brokers and customers. Answering all phone calls whenever possible via Bluetooth.

Document and log work/rest periods and miles spent driving and retain fuel/weight scale receipts.

Scan bill of ladings after successfully completing a load through the ClearScanner or a similar app.
Skills

Proven work experience as a truck driver
Hands on experience with a manual truck
Ability to overcome daily challenges of a driver such as traffic congestion, difficult clients, etc.
Willingness to learn with a positive attitude
Ability to drive long hours and travel regularly
No recent moving or driving violations
Adaptability and foresight to handle unexpected situations (traffic, weather conditions etc)
Valid truck driving license and medical card
Our regular policy is to sanitize and deep clean our equipment prior to keep our drivers happy and comfortable.

Attention all healthcare professionals! Surrogacy is a rewarding experience for everyone involved. 


 You don‚Äôt have to choose between surrogacy or a job. You can do surrogacy as a stay-at-home mom or as a second job, all while getting compensated for it. We admire your desire to give the most beautiful gift in the world to a family, while financially helping your own.




"In my quest to fulfill my dream of helping a family through surrogacy I
researched several agencies in the California area. I found so many great 
reviews on Physician's Surrogacy. I called and the staff was quick to 
answer all my questions. They certainly helped put my mind at ease and 
was the first agency (I called several) tat I spoke with where I finally  
sensed "this is where I belong."



Your safety and happiness are our primary concern. A surrogacy journey is an emotional and complex medical process that can change lives and bring joy to all involved. Our team of physicians work diligently to ensure a safe and smooth journey. Take the first step by completing your application today to find out if you're eligible. Did you know you can earn up to $11,000 before you are even pregnant? 





Physician's Surrogacy is the leading surrogacy agency in San Diego, with the largest program in North America, providing comprehensive agency services for more than 20 years.

       Our in-house physicians and caring surrogacy coordinators will be happy to guide you through our surrogacy process. Also, our in-house OB liaison can answer any medical questions you may have. Together, we have over 150+ combined years of clinical and professional experience.


Basic Criteria:


Ages 20-37 years old
Have had at least one child of your own
No major complications during pregnancy and/or delivery
Live a healthy lifestyle (no drugs, smoking and healthy body weight)
Arizona, California, Colorado, DC, Delaware, Florida, Illinois, Maine, Maryland, New Hampshire, New Jersey, Nevada, Oregon, Texas, Rhode Island, South Carolina, Utah, Vermont,  or Washington Resident






First Time Surrogacy Compensation Starts At 



Our compensation package is hard to beat, but if you find a higher package, we will happily match it.
		Second or third time surrogates will qualify for higher compensation. 
		As with most agencies, compensation is commensurate with experience, and experienced 
		surrogates will qualify for higher compensation. At Physician's Surrogacy, we believe 
		surrogates should be compensated for the time, commitment, and physical sacrifices 
		made during their journey.





The Ultimate Surrogacy Experience:


           With our monthly support groups, dedicated support teams, and lifetime opportunity, we provide a convenient, caring, and experienced environment for this beautiful journey. One of our experienced Surrogate Coordinators would love to speak with you and answer any questions you may have.







Have Questions Before You Apply? 


            We offer informal information calls to make sure that surrogacy is right for you and your family. To further enhance your decision-making process, you can also call or text to set an appointment to visit our facility.  Feel free to 
chat with us on our website if you have any further questions.






Follow Us

Job Title: PAID RESEARCH for people at high risk of chronic disease
Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


An innovation and design team (sponsored by a pharmaceutical company) is interested in speaking with people about their health. We are seeking people that are medium to high risk of a chronic disease. The team wants to understand how you think about risk, prevention and what it means to take action to manage your health.

There is the potential to two parts to this research:

1. Researchers will be asking people to log into a portal every day for 7 days to complete a diary study which will consist of answering questions, writing about your experiences and completing some exercises. Participants are paid $150 for this time. This study runs from 2/22 - 2/28.

2. A small handful of diary study participants will be invited to participate in a video conference interview lasting either 60 or 90 minutes compensating you either $100 or $150 depending on the length of the interview. These follow-ups will take place the week of 3/3 - 3/5.

All information shared will be kept completely confidential. Further, all identifying information will be anonymized and only reported in aggregate.

You have the right, in the interview process, to not answer questions or disclose anything you do not wish to disclose.

Should you want to be considered, please take a moment and tell us a bit more about yourself and how you might fit the research in the following survey. Please note, this survey is longer than usual so please be sure you have 10 minutes to complete it.

Link: https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/KYTSNK7

Thanks, in advance, for your time.
Other Job Attributes:
compensation: $150

employment type: contract

Job Title: CDL CLASS A DRIVERS $1800-$2200 WEEKLY (for dry van and reefer)
Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


TWENTY 4 SEVEN EXPRESS INC. is looking for CDL Class A Over the road Driver.

Twenty 4 Seven Express is a smaller outfit focused on bringing the best miles for our drivers. The key to success both as a driver and company is to keep moving without down time and without sitting around waiting for loads. We offer pre-plans from our dispatch team, this way you are always pre booked ahead to know where you are moving next. Our company is dedicated to make sure you make what you deserve and keep you busy if you are away from home and your family. Our drivers make anywhere from $1800-$2200 weekly. The miles for the week (7 day work week) are 3000+ Miles so you will need to be able to handle these miles on week to week basis. We pride ourselves to be a company that always pays you on time and gives you the earnings that you deserve to be out over the road.  If you are hard working and get under paid don't miss out a great opportunity to work for a great outfit and start making $100K+ annually.

Here are the Requirements for this position:

- 3 year experience is a must with a CLASS-A CDL
- Driver has to have or get Hazmat/Tanker Endorsements within 1 month of employment.
- This Position is for a Reefer or Dry Van Trailer
- Driver has to be able to handle 3000+ miles a week.
- Minimum of 2 week stay out time is required.
- No Recent Log Book Violations
- No out of service violations for log books for the past year.

Job Description

- 48 state hauling
- ONLY ONE TRUCK AVAILABLE AT THIS TIME
- 55c a mile start pay (WITH HAZMAT) If you don't have HAZMAT you will start at .55c a mile however you need to be willing to get the Hazmat within the first month of employment (we will cover your hazmat endorsement fees)
- Pay Day Every Friday with direct deposit.
- 3000+ miles a week. (All our drivers avg around 3300-3600 miles per week)
- Keep Trucking ELD with Tablet.
- Unlimited DATA on Tablet.
- Pre-Plans for loads (Never sit around waiting for loads we always pre plan so you are moving all the time)
- 1099 Pay (we don't hold anything back)
- $100 Mileage Bonus for the month (1st Place for Miles in the Company within the month)
- $100 Good Inspection Bonus (level 1, level 2, or level 3) (immediate pay) You can get as many inspections as you wish its $100 every time you get a good inspection.
- Driver has to have a Smart Phone
- Driver has to have a working e mail on his phone or we can provide an e mail for you with the Tablet


Job available right away and will be given to first person that applies with clean background and clean MVR. We need to talk before you are sent a Application since you will need to be cleared by our Insurance Company to get hired on.

CALL OR E MAIL US TODAY

773-310-4240

COMPANY PROVIDED‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.

*VEHICLE*

*FUEL*

Journeyman Electrician: Commercial



JOB DESCRIPTION

Summary/ ObjectiveThe Journeyman Electrician position is responsible for performing diversified duties to install, troubleshoot, repair and maintain facilities according to safety, predictive and productive maintenance systems and processes to support the achievement of the customer‚Äôs business goals and objectives. We furnish a company vehicle, all fuel, vehicle maintenance, and a company Phone. We offer paid vacations, sick days, paid holidays, and have voluntary plans in health insurance and ancillary insurance.

Responsibilities/Duties

¬∑ Assemble, install, test, and maintain electrical or electronic wiring, equipment, appliances, apparatus, and fixtures, using hand tools and power tools.

¬∑ Diagnose malfunctioning systems, apparatus, and components, using test equipment and hand tools, to locate the cause of a breakdown and correct the problem.

¬∑ Connect wires to circuit breakers, transformers, or other components.

¬∑ Working on both residential and commercial new installs and remodeling jobs

¬∑ Inspect electrical systems, equipment, and components to identify hazards, defects, and the need for adjustment or repair, and to ensure compliance with codes.

¬∑ Test electrical systems and continuity of circuits in electrical wiring, equipment, and fixtures.

¬∑ Final Connections

¬∑ Take Pictures, Write up work orders with detailed descriptions, send in paperwork both physically and by email. Turn in paperwork.

¬∑ Be able to use a company phone, use apps, email, and effectively communicate.



Essential Functions

¬∑ Perform highly diversified duties to install and maintain facilities.

¬∑ Provide emergency/unscheduled repairs to facilities and scheduled maintenance repairs of facilities.

¬∑ Perform service repair duties and responsibilities.

¬∑ Perform service skills including, but not limited to, carpentry, plumbing, electrical, troubleshooting and repair of facilities.

¬∑ Read and interpret equipment manuals and work orders to perform required maintenance and service.

¬∑ Diagnose problems, replace or repair parts, test and make adjustments.

¬∑ Perform regular preventive maintenance on facilities.

¬∑ Perform a variety of electrical, plumbing, carpentry maintenance functions.

¬∑ Use a variety of hand and power tools, electric meters and material handling equipment in performing duties.

¬∑ Detect faulty operations, defective material and report those and any unusual situations to proper supervision.

¬∑ Comply with safety regulations and maintain clean and orderly work areas.

¬∑ Be able to take before and after photos of each service with company provided phone

¬∑ Check In/Out on company and customer systems.

¬∑ Turn in Monthly Vehicle Condition reports.

¬∑ Be insurable under company insurance company.

¬∑ Have good attendance habits.

Competencies

¬∑ Technical Capacity.

¬∑ Ethical Conduct.

¬∑ Communication Proficiency.

¬∑ Results Driven.

¬∑ Good Attendance Habits.

* Supervisory Responsibility
This position has no supervisory responsibilities.

Work Environment
Work is regularly performed in a combination of office, warehouse, outdoor, and shop environments and is regularly exposed to dust, odors, oil, fumes and noise.

Physical Demands
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear. This position is very active and requires standing, walking, bending, kneeling, stooping, crouching, crawling, and climbing all day. The employee must frequently lift and/or move items over 75 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.

Position Type/Expected Hours of Work
This is a full-time position, and hours of work and days are dependent on the service cal. There is On-Call Duty on scheduled rotations.

Travel : Drive & Travel is expected for this position. (Company provided vehicle and fuel card)

Required Education and Experience

¬∑ 2+ years of Electrical Journeyman License

¬∑ High school diploma/GED and completion of a craft apprenticeship, or an equivalent number of years of education and production maintenance experience.

Preferred Education and Experience

¬∑ 2+ years of Electrical Journeyman Experience

Additional Eligibility Qualifications
You must possess a strong background in at least two of the following skill sets: Electrical, Plumbing, Drywall Repairs, Painting, Flooring, General Carpentry, Locks.

You must furnish your own hand tools and must be able to pass a drug screen and background check.

Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Currently we have the leads appointments, administrative support and training bandwidth to sell 6¬† businesses per month. However, with our current Business Broker count, we are hitting those numbers. Simply put, we don't have the business brokers to service the business we have coming in, let alone for the rest 2021.¬†¬†

Q What is Business Broker?
A Business Brokers help business owners find buyers for their businesses.

Q How do we do this?
A You will receive first class training on how to talk to the business owners. Buyers will find you through our massive advertising on business sales web sites. (BizBuySell.com)

Q How do I get paid?
A. We charge a Business Owner up to 15 % based on the selling price or $15,000 minimum, which we collect when the business is transferred to the new owner. The agent starts at a 50% split of the fee and it goes up from there.

Q Who is First Choice Business Brokers?
A We have been in business since 1994. We are a National Business Brokerage Franchise with offices around the US with over 7 Billion in transactions.

Q Is this a salaried position?
A. Business sales is a commission profession. However, you can expect to earn $60,000.00 to $80,000 your first year if you follow our training and our system. This is NOT a job, it is a career.

Q How was Business Sales affected by the recession?
A Almost no effect since business sales are not related to residential sales. Our business sales were strong during and after the recession.

Q Is this an overcrowded profession, in other words is there a lot of competition?
A There are very few Business Brokers. Our National Organization (IBBA) has approximately 600 to 800 members Worldwide. There are only 4,000 Business Brokers in the entire US. As a comparison, in Las Vegas, there are 16,000 realtors and only THIRTY (30) Business Brokers.

Q. How is the current economy affecting Business Sales?
A. One word could answer this question, Booming. We have seen more buyers in these last few years who want to join in the growth of the New York Region. Sellers are also looking to sell to move onto other business opportunities. We have always found that the Buyers are always looking to take advantage of growing industries. According to Fox Business Report, Business Sales were up 49% over previous years. Now is certainly the time to enter our profession.

Q What is the preferred background of a successful agent?
A Professional sales, prior business owners, advertising sales, insurance agents, CPA's, mortgage professionals., You should be someone who is willing to learn the business and able to understand why a person is in business and why a buyer wants to be self-employed.

Q Do I need to be an accountant or have an accounting background?
A Although we do have quite a few former accountants in our group, an accounting background is NOT required.

Q. What else is required?
A. You must be able present yourself in a professional manner to clients.

Q. Can I keep my other job while getting licensed and receiving training?
A. We understand that this may be necessary and we will work with qualified candidates.

Q. What Does It Cost?
A. Training costs $600. Monthly Fee $175 Plus whatever you decide to spend on your own marketing. We suggest a monthly marketing budget of $1,000.00

Q How do I get started?
A Contact our office at 713-400-7663

Q. What else do I need to know?
Go to our website and fill out the contact form: https://houstontxbusinessesforsale.com/join-our-team
Other Job Attributes:
compensation: The agent starts at a 50% split of the fee and it goes up from there. Business sales is a commission profession.

QR Code Link to This Post


COMPANY PROVIDED‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.

*VEHICLE*

*FUEL*

*CELL PHONE*



TECHNICIAN

Handyman - Commercial ‚Äì (General Carpentry, Electrical, Plumbing)

JOB DESCRIPTION

Summary/Objective

The Facility Maintenance Technician position is responsible for performing diversified duties to install, troubleshoot, repair and maintain facilities according to safety, predictive and productive maintenance systems and processes to support the achievement of the customer‚Äôs business goals and objectives. We are looking for candidates with excellent attitudes and someone who is willing to take care of the customer. We furnish a company vehicle, all fuel, vehicle maintenance, and a company Phone. We offer paid vacations, sick days, paid holidays, and have voluntary plans in health insurance and ancillary insurance. If you are passionate about what you do and looking for a job then we want to talk to you.

Essential Functions

¬∑ Perform diversified duties to install and maintain facilities.

¬∑ Provide emergency/unscheduled repairs to facilities and scheduled maintenance repairs of facilities.

¬∑ Perform service repair duties and responsibilities.

¬∑ Perform service skills including, but not limited to, carpentry, plumbing, electrical, troubleshooting and repair of facilities.

¬∑ Read and interpret equipment manuals and work orders to perform required maintenance and service.

¬∑ Diagnose problems, replace or repair parts, test and make adjustments.

¬∑ Perform regular preventive maintenance on facilities.

¬∑ Perform a variety of electrical, plumbing, carpentry maintenance functions.

¬∑ Use a variety of hand and power tools, meters and material handling equipment in performing duties.

¬∑ Detect faulty operations, defective material and report those and any unusual situations to proper supervision.

¬∑ Comply with safety regulations and maintain clean and orderly work areas.

¬∑ Be able to effectively communicate and use phones (phones company provided)

¬∑ Must be able to use apps in phone (phones company provided)

¬∑ Must be able to turn in all applicable paperwork for each work order (ie. before and after photos, signed and stamped work orders, etc.)

¬∑ Must maintain regular work attendance habits / good work attendance habits.



Competencies

¬∑ Technical Capacity.

¬∑ Ethical Conduct.

¬∑ Communication Proficiency.

¬∑ Results Driven.

¬∑ Good Attendance Habits.

Supervisory Responsibility

This position has no supervisory responsibilities.

Work Environment

Work is regularly performed in a combination of office, warehouse, outdoor, and shop environments and is regularly exposed to dust, odors, oil, fumes and noise.

Physical Demands

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear. This position is very active and requires standing, walking, bending, kneeling, stooping, crouching, crawling, and climbing all day. The employee must frequently lift and/or move items over 75 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.

Position Type/Expected Hours of Work

This is a Reactive to Service Calls type job. There is On-Call Duty on scheduled rotations.

Travel

Travel is expected for this position. (Must have a valid updated driver license) (Must be able to drive). (Must also be able to be insurable by the companies auto insurance company.)

Required Education and Experience

¬∑ High school diploma/GED and completion of a craft apprenticeship, or an equivalent number of years of education and production maintenance experience.

Preferred Education and Experience

2+ years of Commercial Experience in plumbing, carpentry, handyman, electrical

Additional Eligibility Qualifications

You must possess a strong background at least two of the following skill sets:

Plumbing, Electrical, Drywall Repairs, Painting, Flooring, Carpentry, Locks

You must furnish your own hand tools, power tools, and must be able to pass a drug screen and background check.

AAP/EEO Statement

As an equal opportunity employer, ACS Commercial Services, L.L.C. does not discriminate in its employment decisions on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, military status, disability, or on any other basis that would be in violation of any applicable federal, state, or local law. Furthermore, ACS Commercial Services, L.L.C. will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with known disabilities unless doing so would result in an undue hardship, safety, and/or health risk.

Other Duties

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Answering Service in FM 1960 area (1960 & Veterans Memorial) has openings for telephone agents.  These are full time positions (30-40 hours per week / overtime available if desired).  You are scheduled for DAY TIME HOURS.  You must be able to work between the hours of 630am and 730pm and be able to work weekend days.

TS Upset and Thread is a large family owned business in the greater Houston area.  As a processing facility, we handle up 100,000 tons of steel tubing a year for customers all throughout the US.   For 22 years TS Upset has proven its stability through several business cycles and is a great place for workers looking for a long term employment.

Job Description

Lather operator must properly place product in Lathe machine and properly cycle the machine while keeping up with production line.

Primary Responsibilities
-	Verify correct product is placed in production line
-	Place the product correctly in Lathe machine
-	Cycle the Lathe machine while keeping up with production
-	Safely remove metal shavings and place in hopper
-	Must clean and maintain inspection booth as well as general work area
-	Assist in perpetual improvement in general work area, department and other work areas as required

Qualifications
-	High School Diploma preferred
-	Must be a quick learner

Integrated Life Choices (ILC) works with the Department of Health and Human Services to meet the needs of people in the community who have intellectual and developmental disabilities. Job Title: Truck Driver - CDL Class A/Touch Freight - Penske Logistics
Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


What‚Äôs the Job?Ready to put your truck-driving career in high gear? Make the shift and fuel your career as a CDL Class A/Touch Freight Truck Driver for Penske. When you join Penske, you join a team of professional truck drivers committed to delivering products safely and on time. And we‚Äôre proud to haul freight for some of the world‚Äôs leading brands. (Yes, we‚Äôre more than just the yellow trucks.)
But it‚Äôs more than that. It‚Äôs about incredible customer service and building relationships with your accounts. When you drive for Penske, you‚Äôre representing Penske, but you‚Äôre also representing your clients. In fact, you‚Äôll probably be driving their branded trucks and wearing their uniform.
You‚Äôll be on the move with Penske‚Äîand so will your career. We have tons of training opportunities for you. And with locations across the nation, you can also move to a new city.
Best of all, you‚Äôll be with a stable, nationwide company that is known for having the best equipment, great management, clear communication and a fantastic safety record. We pay every Friday, and for most of our driving positions, you‚Äôre home daily. Yes, daily. Are you ready to take it to the next level? Come drive for Penske.
The Specifics:‚Ä¢ Route/activity: Truck drivers are responsible for delivering supplies locally. 2-5 stops, 150-300 miles per route. Touch freight, home daily!‚Ä¢ Shift: Monday-Friday, dispatch at midnight.‚Ä¢ Equipment: Single and tandem axle day cabs, 48‚Äô & 53‚Äô dry van trailers.‚Ä¢ Compensation: $23.11 per hour. OT after 40 hours!
Opportunity to earn a safety bonus, which is paid out twice a year up to $500 annually.
PTO: First year associates are eligible for up to 13 days of paid time off and 7 paid holidays. After your first year, PTO eligibility is based on years of service.
Main Responsibilities:‚Ä¢ Driving your assigned truck safely and responsibly‚Ä¢ Following all federal and/or state laws, regulations, and/or agency rules, standards and guidelines‚Ä¢ Reporting problems with your truck, as well as accidents, traffic violations, and damage before and after route‚Ä¢ Acting as the main point of contact with your customer
Why Penske is for You:‚Ä¢ Outstanding company safety record‚Ä¢ Premier Driver Recognition Program‚Ä¢ Home daily for most positions‚Ä¢ Competitive starting salary‚Ä¢ Career stability‚Ä¢ Opportunity for growth‚Ä¢ Excellent benefits, including lots of time off‚Ä¢ Superior trucks and 24/7 roadside support‚Ä¢ Dedicated accounts‚Ä¢ Lots of training opportunities
Habla espanol? Nosotros tambien! Llamenos hoy 855-CDL-PENSKE!
Qualifications:‚Ä¢ CDL Class A required‚Ä¢ Currently hold, or ability to obtain, a non-excepted interstate DOT medical card required‚Ä¢ 1 year of documented tractor-trailer experience in the last 3 years required, or 2 years of documented tractor-trailer experience in the last 5 years‚Ä¢ 3 years DMV/MVR record with two or fewer moving violations or accidents‚Ä¢ Reliable‚Ä¢ Excellent customer service skills‚Ä¢ Focused on safety‚Ä¢ Regular, predictable, full attendance is an essential function of the job‚Ä¢ Willingness to travel as necessary, work the required schedule, work at the specific location required, complete Penske employment application, submit to a background investigation (to include past employment, education, and criminal history) and drug screening required.
This position is regulated by the Department of Transportation or designated as safety sensitive by the company, and the ability to work in a constant state of alertness and in a safe manner is required. Associates must have the ability to accept responsibility for their own safety, as well as the safety of others.
Physical Requirements:‚Ä¢ The physical and mental demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an associate to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.‚Ä¢ The associate must be able to see and hear. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.‚Ä¢ While performing the duties of this job, the associate will be required to move frequently, stand, walk, and sit. The associate is frequently required to use hands to touch, handle, and feel, and to reach with hands and arms. The associate must be able to regularly lift and/or move up to 50lbs/23kg and occasionally lift and/or move up to 100lbs/45kg.‚Ä¢ The associate must be able to legally operate a motor vehicle and safely and frequently enter/exit the vehicle as well as the rear cargo area.
Penske is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
About Penske LogisticsPenske Logistics is a wholly owned subsidiary of Penske Truck Leasing. With operations in North America, South America, Europe and Asia, Penske Logistics provides supply chain management and logistics services to leading companies around the world. Penske Logistics delivers value through its design, planning and execution in transportation, warehousing and freight management. Visit www.PenskeLogistics.com to learn more.

Job Title: Seasonal Seafood Processor - Westward Seafoods - Dutch Harbor, Alaska
Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


We are looking for people willing to go now and stay until the end of A Season.
Interviews being held now!
apply at https://rb.gy/xvpoqq or www.westwardseafoods.com

Production PROCESSORS needed for our shore-based plants located in DUTCH HARBOR, Alaska and UNALASKA, Alaska. Work has already started 

WSI processes several species of seafood including Pollock, Crab, Pacific Cod, Halibut and Sablefish. Production employees process raw product that is delivered from fishing vessels to sell to customers. Processors can be assigned to various positions within the production department including, but not limited to, butchering, sorting, filleting, and case-up. Processors are also required to participate in plant clean-up, and other duties as assigned.

This position requires the candidate have the ability to perform the physical requirements including; standing in place for long periods of time; repetitive motions using hands, arms, legs and back; regularly lift and move 50 lbs; frequent rotations and twisting at waist; frequent climbing and descending of stairs; working long hours in cold/wet environments (12+ hours per day, 7 days a week); and prompt and regular attendance.

All WSI employees are required to wear protective safety gear where required and are responsible for promoting and maintaining a safe working environment for self and others.

WSI has a zero tolerance policy for drugs and alcohol.

You will be charged $15 per day for room and board. This will be deducted from your paycheck.

Please email Recruiting @ wsi us if you encounter any problems with the online application process.

In order to be considered for hire, applicants MUST:

COMPLETE online application. Click on the link Apply On-line towards the bottom right of this page. Proceed through process and screens until you receive the ON-SCREEN PROMPT you have completed the application.

INCOMPLETE applications CANNOT be taken into consideration toward hire. WSI will make an effort to notify you (via email) if your application is received, incomplete and further action is required. Applications must be completed prior to your attendance at a Recruiting Event.

BE CAREFUL that you submit an application for the JOB and WORK LOCATION you wish to be considered for. There may be multiple positions with the same job title available to applicants. Ensure you refer to the CITY referenced in the Requisition listing.

ATTEND A VIRTUAL INTERVIEW via GOTO Meeting an email from Calendy.com will be sent to you, so you will be able to pick a date and time that‚Äôs good for you. Your APPLICATION must be COMPLETED PRIOR to your virtual interview. BE CAREFUL to submit an application for the requisition/position.

Must be at least 18 years of age, and must pass a post-offer drug screen and physical. Processors must be able to stand and work for long hours in an often wet and cold environment. Shifts will vary depending on fish, and processors must be prepared to work 7 days a week for up to 18 hours per day. There may also be periods of time when there are few or no hours of work. Must be able to repeatedly lift up to 50 pounds. Must have a basic understanding of English, including the ability to follow written or oral instructions. Must be able to climb stairs, and stand and walk on uneven and slippery surfaces. Must be willing to work any shift, including nights. Processing employees must be able to walk quickly to designated areas in the event of an emergency and must be able to follow emergency instructions. All WSI employees must be willing to work and live in a multi-cultural environment.

Westward Seafoods is an equal opportunity employer. We consider applicants for all position without regard to race, religion, creed, national origin, age, disability, martial or veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by applicable law. Please let us know if you need reasonable accommodation during the hiring process.

Texas Freight Services is now hiring company drivers and Owner/Operators with at least one year of verifiable tractor-trailer driving experience. We are a non-hazmat carrier using all 53' dry vans, all no touch and lots of drop and hook. We have consistent, high volume freight running between Houston, Dallas/Fort Worth and the south central / southeast regions. We have the miles you need and the home time you want - including home daily!

Company Drivers:

‚Ä¢ Weekly Pay and Direct Deposit
‚Ä¢ Paid Orientation + Sign On Bonus
‚Ä¢ Medical, Dental and Vision
‚Ä¢ No Forced Dispatch
‚Ä¢ Regional Long Haul, Short Haul, and Local Positions Available

Owner/Operators:

‚Ä¢ Weekly Settlements and Direct Deposit + Sign On Bonus
‚Ä¢ Free Secure Truck & Personal Vehicle Parking at our Houston & Fort Worth Terminals
‚Ä¢ EFS Fuel Card with Outstanding Discounts at All Major Truck Stop Chains

‚Ä¢ No Forced Dispatch
‚Ä¢ Easy to use ELD with Premium Navigation
‚Ä¢ Fuel Taxes Paid

Incorporated in 1994, Texas Freight Services is a full truck load carrier based in Houston, TX. We specialize in dedicated fleet services to customers that expect 100% on-time delivery. This commitment to service has fueled our remarkable growth from a single truck to a nationwide carrier with almost 200 power units, over 600 trailers and three full service terminals. We've built a team of transportation professionals that provide our customers and driver partners with the highest level of service and support. At Texas Freight Services, quality, reliability and integrity are the guiding principles behind everything we do.

If you want to partner with a carrier that truly values its drivers and independent contractors, we want to hear from you. We strive every day to provide dependable, first-rate pay and benefits to our drivers without sacrificing the home time you and your family deserves. Just pick up the phone and give us a call today, recruiters available Monday through Friday from 7:00 am to 4:00 pm, or for faster service apply now with our convenient online driver application!

Job Title: Foreign Currency Trader - Finance, Part Time, Work From Home - Remote
Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Top-ranked proprietary trading firm, Maverick Trading, is searching for entrepreneurially-minded, profit-driven people to be trained in the art and science of proprietary trading in its online foreign exchange trading division, Maverick FX.  Successful candidates will trade foreign currencies with the firm's capital on behalf of the firm and reap the majority share of the profits.

As one of the best proprietary Forex trading firms in the industry, Maverick FX offers its traders impressive capital and leverage, comprehensive training, and extensive support and mentoring.  We teach our traders how to trade in the Forex market.  Maverick FX's capital base, training, and reputation has allowed us to partner with the top currency trading broker to offer our traders tighter spreads and better execution than the typical retail Forex firm.

The Forex market is open 23-1/2 hours a day, five days a week.  This time horizon allows the firm to offer its traders flexible hours and the ability to start part-time and transition into full-time trading.  Prop forex trading is a mentally engaging, challenging profession where diligence and consistency translate directly into financial reward.  In other words, this is truly meaningful work.  The firm's traders have the opportunity to practice their craft from anywhere in the world via high-speed internet.

---About Maverick Trading FX Division---

Started in 1997, Maverick Trading is one of the most experienced prop trading firms and is ranked as one of the top trading companies in the industry, accepting and funding experienced traders as well as teaching motivated people from all backgrounds how to become traders.  The firm's Maverick FX Division has been actively trading the Forex markets since 2009.  As a result of a long track record of success, the firm has the capital to back and fund its traders with meaningful amounts of capital.

Each trader starts live trading with a minimum of a $10,000 account ($500,000 in buying power) and keeps 70% to 80% of trading profits.  As you gain experience and demonstrate consistent profitability you become eligible for greater amounts of the firm's capital.  Our top traders can trade up to $300,000 ($15 million in buying power).  Profitable traders are also eligible for Performance Bonuses.

---How to Apply---

Our application process is multi-step and designed to educate you on prop trading, how we train, support and fund our traders, and how we pay out profits to you, as well as focus you for your interview where you can have any remaining questions answered and discuss with your recruiter why Maverick FX is a good fit for you.
To get started, click on the application link below.  This will take you to a short video that will discuss Maverick FX and its Capital Sharing Program (how you get funded and paid).

When you complete the application process, you will be contacted by one of our experienced recruiters (who are also traders themselves) for a Suitability Interview.

CLICK on the link below to begin the application process:

https://maverickfx.com/maverick-trading/apply/fx-division/?utm_source=clfxhouston


If you're interested in trading the markets at a professional level, whether part-time, full-time, or in a transitional or supplementary income capacity, it pays to start with one of the best prop trading firms in the industry.  

We look forward to speaking with you and exploring if you'll be the next great trader to join us.

Cheers,

The Maverick FX Team

FREEDOM EXPRESS ‚Äì *DRYVAN* OPERATIONS

We are a Florida based Dryvan Carrier with a large and active NATIONAL customer base that allows us to offer Both REGIONAL and FULL OTR lanes to the States YOU specify, and with a Home-Time schedule that YOU determine.

You will not find a more driver friendly company to work with, than Freedom Express Jacksonville, a Dryvan Division of the US 1 and Freedom 1 Networks.


FREEDOM EXPRESS OFFERS THE FOLLOWING:

‚Ä¢ FREE TAG!! (we will register and plate your truck with a 48 State Apportioned IRP tag at NO COST to you, and we will renew it for you every year. FREE)!!

‚Ä¢ FREE TRAILER!! ‚Äì No Fees or Deductions for this, they are simply FREE! (Plus: we rotate our equipment out to keep them in top condition. The oldest trailer in our fleet is about 1 year old ‚Äì and many of them are brand new)!

‚Ä¢ ZERO DEDUCTION PROGRAM - All Mandatory Deductions (including OccAcc and NTL Insurances, plus your ELD fees), they are all waived. FREE!!

‚Ä¢ PAY PER MILE PROGRAM - ALL DISPATCHED MILES PAID ‚Äì LOADED AND EMPTY ‚Äì You will never have to worry about unpaid deadheads, we pay by the mile, and we pay ALL miles, loaded or empty.

Job Title: Special-$100-Level 3 Security Training. With Job Placement Assistance
Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Level 3 Security Officer Training

$100

The TX PSB Level III course is required for all commissioned (armed) security officers and personal protection officers in the state of Texas. The course is completed over 5 days (10 hours each day) and is designed to certify the officer with the requirements and standards put forth by the Texas PSB. Officers are trained insecurity topics, laws and firearms (range fees included) in this all inclusive course relating to his or her daily assignments and responsibilities. The course covers:

General Training Issues

Relevant Texas Statutes

Field Note Taking and Report Writing

Response to Emergency Situations

Public Perception of Security Officers

Conflict Resolution

 Firearms Training & Range Qualification

Our Level III courses include course materials, and range fees. The only additional cost is handgun ammunition.

Semi-auto handguns are available if needed.

Job Placement Assistance Provided For Our Security Students

Requal for Commissioned Security Officers
$60
The Texas Department of Public Safety, Private Security Bureau requires six (6) hours of Continuing Education (CE) training and firearms requalification every two (2) years to renew the Commissioned and PPO Security Officer License. This course provides the Level III re-qualification training and certification as required by the State of Texas to renew your Commissioned License. It includes both classroom and firearms range qualification.

Bayway Homes is a local homebuilder in existence for 23 years with sales offices in La Porte, Seabrook, Pasadena and coming soon in Dickinson.  Our values include treating everyone fairly, being nice to each other and having fun.

Must be able to complete a sales contract and be the principle point of contact with the home buyer until closing of the new home.

QR Code Link to This Post


Who We Are:  Guthy-Renker is a team of thought partners and creators, inventors and innovators with more than 30 years of product development, branding and marketing success with names you know and trust, delivering beauty you can believe in.  We‚Äôre all about supercharging start-ups and scaling brands and drive and take pride in every stage of development from idea to inception to omni-channel roll out.

Our mission‚Äîto change how you look, feel and live‚Äîis more than a purpose, it‚Äôs our call to action.

To match the rapid growth and launch of several amazing new products (such as our newest ‚Äì JLO Beauty!) ‚Äì we are seeking Freelance Sales and Education Field Associate to join our team. We are looking for Freelancers in all states and Puerto Rico to support local retailers.


General Summary: This position will support in store sales and education for the NEW JLO BEAUTY brand and could also include our legacy brands (Crepe Erase, Meaningful Beauty and Volaire) in specialty stores. They will work to drive sales and inspire in-store teams through education and sales. They will be responsible for a sales goal and partner with store teams to drive in store activations and events. Due to the flexible nature of the position, this role will be at various locations vs. a permanent retail store. Candidates cannot be currently employed with Sephora or Ulta.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities: 

‚Ä¢	Connect with clients and determine needs 
‚Ä¢	Introduce JLO BEAUTY to new clients
‚Ä¢	Educate retailer teams on JLO BEAUTY product knowledge to elevate brand awareness and achievement of sales goals so that they can continue to generate sales for the brand when you are not present in store
‚Ä¢	Create a luxury experience with brand-specific, client-centric selling behaviors (including product demonstration)
‚Ä¢	Empower the client by teaching them how to use their products
‚Ä¢	Exhibit a drive for results with integrity
‚Ä¢	Consistently MEET and EXCEED minimum daily sales volume per hour goals
‚Ä¢	Ensure primary and secondary brand locations are merchandised and fully stocked according to brand/retailer merchandising guidelines
‚Ä¢	Consistently represent each brand and support brand identity & demonstrate core values 
‚Ä¢	Attend JLO BEAUTY hosted digital learning modules as scheduled
‚Ä¢	Follow all brand and retailer guidelines
‚Ä¢	Work closely with the Global Director of Education & Field to communicate wins/opportunities

Key Skills and Competencies: 
‚Ä¢	Ability to approach clients, start conversations and conduct product demonstrations (as allowed by retailer) 
‚Ä¢	Exceptional relationship building skills
‚Ä¢	Upholds confidentiality and use sound judgment 
‚Ä¢	Possess exceptional written and verbal communication skills
‚Ä¢	Powerful business acumen and information management skills 
‚Ä¢	Collaborative and a team player 
‚Ä¢	Computer/digital literacy 


Experience and Skills: 

‚Ä¢	Must have a high school degree and be 18 years or older.
‚Ä¢	Cosmetics sales experience preferred
‚Ä¢	Esthetician certification a plus but not required
‚Ä¢	Flexible thinking and an ability to handle change with a positive approach 
‚Ä¢	A sincere PASSION for skincare and cosmetics 
‚Ä¢	A self-motivated competitive personality 
‚Ä¢	Reliable transportation 
‚Ä¢	Ability to work a flexible schedule including nights, weekends and/or holidays as the brand and retailer needs require
‚Ä¢	Be reliable and punctual
‚Ä¢	Ability to travel within market to support stores as assigned and a willingness to drive a minimum of 20-30 miles

Physical Environment: Must be able to work on the sales floor for extended periods, stand for up to 8 hours, walk up and down a flight of stairs, and lift up to 25 lbs. on a regular basis.


Guthy|Renker is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Other Job Attributes:
compensation: DOE

ARCA Statewide Logistics LLC is a family owned company located in Humble, TX and we are looking for qualified, responsible, and dependable Owner Operators to join our fleet.

We have alot of work coming up and need to fill positions quickly. 

Experience is a major plus. We are open to training the right person.

All Owner Operators must meet the minimum requirements...

DRIVER REQUIRMENTS
Must be over 25 years of age.
Must have CDL A for minimum of 3 years.
No Accidents or Tickets last 5 years.
Must pass DOT drug screen.
Must be honest, work safely, drive responsibly, and adhere to all Federal and State laws.
Must be willing work days, nights, and weekends (within legal hours).
Must be able to properly fill out required paperwork and turn in completed paperwork.
Must be able to follow instructions to ensure the safe operation of equipment.
Must conduct proper pre and post trip inspections on equipment.
Must adhere to all company and customer safety protocols.

EQUIPMENT REQUIRMENTS

Equipment must meet DOT requirements and have valid registration and inspection.
Must have blower. We can install blowers with our maintenance shop.
Own trailer is a plus. We do have trailers available to lease. First come, first serve.
Owner Operator must drive truck.

We are a company that stresses service quality, on time delivery, safety, and relationships. We want drivers that fit these qualities.

Pay to Owner Operator is 85% of revenue generated by truck.

Please contact us to schedule an interview at (832) 797-4495 or (832) 453-9746. You may also reach by replying to post.

¬∑ Responsible for maintaining ISO standards
¬∑ Responsible for reporting safety issues to personnel with authority to initiate action
¬∑ Performs other duties and/or completes training as required by Supervisor.

Work is good. Where you do it matters!

We are WORKSUITES, a growing, dynamic, professional, shared office space organization with locations positioned throughout the DFW Metroplex and Houston. Whether you are looking to begin or advance your career, WORKSUITES is a great place to be. We believe in entrepreneurship, cultivating environments that encourage teamwork and growth, and above all, creating a work culture that feels like family! We are currently looking for highly organized, self-motivated individuals to join our team of professionals. As WORKSUITES employees, we are the welcoming first face of many organizations, we proudly embrace the role of extra employee, assistant, partner, consultant and friend. You will take on an active role in the success of the organizations that trust us to be their provider for office space. Choose to be a part of a team that is a leader in its industry, is client focused, and recognizes that our biggest asset is YOU!

About this Position:

There is a constant buzz present at all our locations. For us to uphold our goals of being client focused we need support! As a community supporter, your primary function will be to operate in a collaborative role that sustains the culture of your community.

This is a part-time position would be our Woodlands location. Hours are 11 am - 3 pm, Monday through Friday.

Daily Activities:

Accept and transfer incoming phone calls: for many of our clients, you are the first voice their clients hear. You will provide an exceptional level of customer service with the understanding that you are an extension not only of WORKSUITES but of our client‚Äôs organizations.
Ensure that your center is always a productive and empowering environment, every detail is important! You will participate in daily hospitality operations to include, loading and unloading the dishwasher, making coffee throughout day, staying on top of kitchen cleanliness and tidying up meeting rooms and common areas in between uses.
WORKSUITES is the premier destination for meeting room options in Houston and the DFW Metroplex. You will support this valuable service by booking client meeting room requests for various WORKSUITES locations. Maximize your time-management skills and support our clients by managing the daily appointment calendar, updating no-shows and cancellations throughout the day to capitalize daily usage of meeting rooms and on-demand offices.
Recognize that every visitor is a potential client: be a gracious host to all incoming visitors by offering coffee and water, notify clients of visitor arrival and directing to designated meeting space.
Support client business functions by receiving, sorting and distributing mail and packages in a timely manner, daily. Create FedEx labels as needed, weigh and post letters.
As the additional pair of hands to many of our clients, you will be trusted to manage confidential and sensitive information as well as participate in various administrative tasks such as; data entry, filing, faxing, scanning and copying.
Required Skills:

Excellent customer service skills
Outstanding time management skills
Problem solver with an ability to multitask
Excellent written and oral skills
Strong attention to detail
Self-motivator
Proficient in Microsoft Office including, Word, Excel and Outlook
HS diploma or equivalent
Six months or more of administrative or executive assistant experience preferred

We want to curate a team of skillful artisans who maintain a positive, fun vibe that ensures our Guests love our service as much as our food.What you‚Äôll love about working for HopdoddyWe have fun taking service seriously and celebrate your authentic individualityWe bring out your potential to grow and advance through our Certified Trainer and Lead Manager programs.We offer competitive pay.We provide Health, Vision, and Dental for full timers starting at $1/day.We give 50% team member discounts on food for you and a friend.We offer perks like anniversary gifts, paid vacation, & parental leave.We give back to our communities through our Goodnight Good Cause program, donating over a million dollars to date.What we‚Äôll love about working with youYou bring a positive energy and a sense of humor.You put Guests first and have a heart for hospitality.You work with the team to get the job done in a fun day.You are passionate about quality, standards, and safety.Job ResponsibilitiesPreparing products for the station.Keep a clean, safe, and sanitary work environment.Ability to accurately and safely follow recipes and procedures.Ensuring kitchen equipment is functioning properly.Adaptability to learn new menu items and specials.Other RequirementsMust have an active Food Handler Card.Must demonstrate good math and communication skills.Must be able to lift 30lbs frequently and up to 50lbs occasionally.Position requires standing, bending, and walking the entire workday.Restaurant experience preferred.About HopdoddyHopdoddy Burger Bar is an Austin born burger joint created to be different and delicious. Our name comes from the flower that gives beer its personality (Hop) + (Doddy), the nickname given to Black Angus cattle. Together they represent the perfect union of burgers + beer. We are Quality Logistics, LLC.

Work for a debt-free established company in continual operation for 62 years.

We are expanding and looking for drivers that want a permanent home.
Are you looking to be treated with respect?
Not wanting to work for a huge company where you call in with a number instead of a name?
THERE IS A REASON WHY OUR DRIVER TURN OVER IS SO LOW.

A little about us first.
We are a family owned business that was founded in 1959 and we are looking for drivers that want to join our trucking family. We are financially stable; you will not have to worry about your paycheck bouncing. You will talk to a knowledgeable dispatcher on a daily basis that knows who you are down to your favorite football team. If you have any suggestions, we would love to hear about them. In short, we care what you have to say.

Paid on all stops

Vacation and quarterly bonuses

Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


First of all ‚Äì there is No Cost!!

With all the upheaval in America and unemployment at its highest it may be difficult for some of you to recover if you have to rely on others to offer employment. The SBA and private lenders have plans available for easy business start-up to offset the millions of jobs lost in the past year.

The FDIC created a 13-hour business start-up course to help individuals qualify for funding. The SBA has endorsed this program and offers the online course through Blue Banyan Society at NO COST to you or to any aspiring entrepreneurs wanting to start their own business. Franchises, business purchase and start-ups qualify.

The training is intended to give you the basic knowledge you need to start and run your business successfully.

Our lending partner has provided funding services through private loans and SBA loans since 2004 and has funded over 12,000 Individuals for starting a new business with NO customer complaints with the BBB or any government agency that regulates this service/industry. The rates range from 5% to 12% and the terms are 5 to 8 years doc. Very few companies can claim the same.

Credit is not an issue if you have a score of 550 or higher or can bring in a co-signor or partner with a healthy credit score.

Simply reply with your name and email address if you're interested. We will send you a link to get started.

Also, if you have a true entrepreneurial spirit and want to help others succeed we have a few positions available for Business Counselors due to the high demand we are experiencing for the Business Literacy Program. Counselors have the potential to earn $1500 to $3000 per student enrolled in the free FDIC/SBA Business Literacy Course.

QR Code Link to This Post


Job Description
PURPOSE:

The purpose of this document is to outline the job responsibilities of the Core Division Grinder.

REPORTS TO:

Core Division Production Manager, Production Supervisor, Grind Lead Man

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

¬∑ Complete all documentation pertaining to the work assignment

¬∑ Train new hires or engineers associated with the project being worked on

¬∑ Work closely and clearly communicate with the other departments, Grind personnel, Supervisor, and Lead Man

¬∑ Operating a machine consists of:

¬∑ Grinding steam turbine shafts, valve parts, compressor shafts, impellers.

o Able to lift large, heavy equipment using the crane or spreader bar setup when required

o Operate manual and automatic feeds to 0.0002‚Äùas required for final cuts

o Operate machine to make complex angle cuts and threading where multiple speeds and feeds are required

¬∑ Complete assigned jobs start to finish with little or no supervision. This included the ability to perform the following:

o Perform intermediate trigonometry to help determine tooling required to machine the part and best matching method

o Read blue prints, drawings and sketches that may require intermediate math and problems solving skills to calculate dimensions not specified on print

¬∑ Help Maintain Equipment, this includes the following:

o Check / Add oil

o Clean machine after each shift

o Place tooling in correct location and organize

o Dispose of and properly document left over machining stock (New Parts, met Samples)

¬∑ Q.C. all manufactures parts prior to removing from machine and informing the Department Supervisor of the following items:

o When/If item is de-burred

o Once dimensions are verified per print

o Alert Supervisor if there are any discrepancies

o Steps required before part is complete

¬∑ Remain physically active from star of shift to end of shift, including, but is not limited to:

o Sweeping

o Cleaning area

o Organize tooling

o Operating Machine

o Organize project parts

¬∑ Planning ‚Äì Work with Department Supervisor to develop a machine plan:

o Determine what tools will be required prior to starting the machine process

¬∑ Be on the job site and in your assigned work area at the scheduled time

¬∑ Keep work area clean and well organized during all phases of the project

¬∑ Have the ability to use and operate the overhead cranes, torches, grinders and forklifts

¬∑ Comply with the requirements of risk assessments and safety procedures.

¬∑ Use PPE as identified in risk assessments or other related safety documents.

¬∑ Do not undertake activities that have not been risk assessed, or where an assessment is not available or understood.

¬∑ Report any instances of spillage, uncontrolled exposure or other related safety issues to their line manager.

¬∑ Ensure the correct use of waste segregation facilities and the efficient use of natural resources and raw materials.

EXPERIENCE/SKILLS:

¬∑ Must have experience working with turbo machinery

¬∑ Must have the required tools to perform their expected tasks

Equivity provides virtual marketing support to clients, including individuals and small businesses, looking for assistance expanding their marketing reach.  Marketing VAs typically assist clients on an ongoing basis by setting up, maintaining and optimizing digital marketing campaigns. Roadmaster Drivers School, a Premier National Commercial Truck Driver Training School and a subsidiary of Werner Enterprises, Inc., is seeking an experienced and proven manager to provide strong leadership in training the next generation of safe and professional commercial truck drivers at our upcoming Houston, TX campus!

We offer:

‚Ä¢ Full-Time Position
‚Ä¢ Competitive Salary Paid Bi-Weekly ($60,000 - $75,000 based on experience)
‚Ä¢ Health Insurance, Dental Insurance & Vision Insurance
‚Ä¢ Company provided Life and AD&D Insurance
‚Ä¢ Various other Insurance Benefits available
‚Ä¢ Paid Vacation and Sick Time
‚Ä¢ 401(k) Retirement Plan w/ Company Match
‚Ä¢ Employee Stock Purchase Program w/ Company Match
‚Ä¢ Employee Perks Program through Abenity¬Æ
‚Ä¢ Opportunities for Advancement

Job Description:

As the Associate School Manager, you will be directly responsible for the overall administration, coordination and management of the school site operations in various areas as assigned. Areas of responsibility include management of training functions at the school while providing assistance and input to the admissions, administration, student finance, and placement functions of the school. You will be responsible to adhere to operational directives and assist in meeting projections and performance goals. You will work closely with corporate senior management to achieve objectives and grow the location based on network needs. Additional responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
‚Ä¢ Working closely with senior management to maximize school efficiency through adhering to policy and procedures in order to produce well-managed training operation
‚Ä¢ Direct management of CDL Instructors and Training Supervisors on a daily basis
‚Ä¢ Working closely with the admissions department to maximize student enrollments and enroll qualified students for training
‚Ä¢ Working closely with the placement department to ensure qualified students achieve the best possible employment opportunities
‚Ä¢ Assisting in preparation for school inspections by local, state and Federal agencies under the direction of the corporate compliance department
‚Ä¢ Conducting weekly student orientations and monitoring and managing student progress, student attendance, and student retention
‚Ä¢ Responsible for ensuring associates adhere to applicable policies and procedures
‚Ä¢ Assistance and involvement in the hiring, coaching and counseling of school personnel as applicable
‚Ä¢ Responsible for complete, correct and timely submission of all evaluations, forms and required reports associated with school operations and additional reporting as requested
‚Ä¢ Must be able to travel as needed for initial and continuing training purposes and support of other school locations as needed

Qualifications:

‚Ä¢ 3-4 years of managerial and supervisory experience, preferably in the private school industry or transportation industry or a bachelor's degree in Business Administration and minimum 1-2 years of management experience
‚Ä¢ Strong knowledge and understanding of management with a focus on excellent customer service through leadership
‚Ä¢ Excellent communication and presentation skills
‚Ä¢ Able to travel for initial and subsequent training and to provide support for locations as needed
‚Ä¢ Possess strong leadership ability to perform the duties of managing, coordinating and directing school operations with a particular focus on training and administration, with daily support to other functional areas of school operations
‚Ä¢ Ability to assist with the implementation and enforcement of established policies and procedures, and compliance with applicable federal, state and local regulations

Please Apply Here: https://werner.wd1.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/Roadmaster/job/Roadmaster-Houston/Associate-School-Manager_JR10309-1

Paradigm is looking for an Outside Plant Field Technician (OSP) to support our client, an engineering firm specializing in the telecommunications industry. The ideal candidate will be comfortable visiting sites and coordinating placement of new fiber cable and equipment.

**To apply, please email your resume to the email address provided in this post. Thank you!**

Type: 6 month contract-to-hire
Location: Houston, TX
Pay Rate: DOE
Benefits: Medical, dental, vision, life, 401K, PTO, sick leave

Responsibilities of the Outside Plant Field Technician:
- Contact customers to schedule site visits to assess current and proposed telecom facilities
- Visit sites and coordinate the placement of new fiber cable and equipment
- Use a computer to assemble sketches and field documents to deliver to Design and Drafting staff
- Work with a measuring wheel and height stick to check distances, specifications, and to make sure the contractor is doing the job properly
- Work directly with the cable installation contractors and manage the process by documenting and making sure the work is being done properly
- Sign off on the work performed


Our skills and experience wish list includes:
- Prefer Associates degree in Civil Engineering or OSP/Field Technician experience
- Mandatory OSP/ISP design experience with fiber and copper cable
- Must understand telecom practices
- Be able to use a computer with knowledge of Microsoft Office, Google Earth and Dropbox
- Ability to manage schedules to meet critical deadlines
- Must have excellent communication skills
- Availability to work overtime as needed
- Work from home and provide own transportation, computer, and cell phone (standard reimbursement)

**To apply, please email your resume to the email address provided in this post. Thank you!**

Description

Performs various maintenance duties and handles service requests requiring technical labor skills including, but not limited to HVAC repairs and adjustments, electrical installations, plumbing, pool maintenance, light carpentry/construction, dry-walling, painting, vinyl repair and installation, as well as appliance repairs.  Works as a team participant along with the maintenance staff to ensure quality maintenance standards set by the Company are met and exceeded.

Assists in preparing all vacant apartments to a market-ready status by inspecting the condition of electrical, HVAC, plumbing, appliances, drywall, porches, and exterior construction, etc., and repairing these items as necessary.  Must participate in asbestos and lead training or at least be aware of the specific requirements.
Responds to resident service requests and concerns in a timely manner.
Performs on-call emergency service as required.
Diagnoses and troubleshoots mechanical and structural problems.
Reports any maintenance concerns for repairs on vacant, models, clubhouse, and/or common areas to the Maintenance Supervisor. 
Serves as the individual responsible for maintenance in the absence of the Maintenance Supervisor and serves as a role model to peers.
Works closely with management and maintenance staff in developing an integral team that effectively represents the quality and professionalism of GWR Management.
Maintains open communication with the Property Manager and Maintenance Supervisor
Attends and participates in training seminars as requested.
Assists other staff members as needed.
Attends and assists in setting up for resident functions and activities.
May assist in monitoring and/or controlling maintenance inventory and/or supplies.  Maintains Company tools, equipment, and vehicles in good condition.
Drives motorized vehicle on or off property for Company business as needed.
Moves heavy objects as requested.
Assists the Maintenance Supervisor or Property Manager on special maintenance projects, i.e., preventative maintenance of building components and/or mechanicals.
Assists in keeping the grounds and common areas free of trash and debris.
May assist the Maintenance Supervisor in assigning service requests.
May assist in training and development of the maintenance staff.
Represents the Company in a professional manner at all times, on or off the property.  Consistently maintains a professional, courteous attitude when dealing with residents, coworkers and the general public.
Performs other duties as assigned.

High school diploma or equivalent is required.  3 to 5 years of verifiable hands-on technical work experience in the areas of plumbing, electrical, carpentry/construction, HVAC, etc. preferred.  Ability to work in a fast paced environment, must exhibit at all times compliance with GWR Management Customer Service policy to customers and coworkers.

Hand tools normally used in construction, maintenance and landscaping including, but not limited to, hedge trimmer, power floor cleaner, carpet shampoo machine, paint sprayer, power drain cleaner, chain saw, key machine, and all chemicals associated with maintenance and landscaping essential job functions.  Motorized vehicles. Valid driver‚Äôs license and good driving record along with auto insurance required. EPA Certification required.

Our average to lower end representatives are making $2500/week with our top trainer representatives making over $10,000 a week. There is no limit to what you can do here. Are you looking to just be a sales representative with your own hours and own time limits set making a low 6 figure income you can do that. Are you looking to build a team and get to that high 6 figure income or beyond? You can do that. We are here to help train you to become successful!

AS well as having the opportunity listed above to do Security, Solar, and many other avenues we have. However, your main bread and butter will be TV services at first as this is the quickest most reliable income revenue. **Please Provide your Resume with Application**

About: 
Our client is one of the largest manufacturing organizations in their field with manufacturing plants, offices, clients, and vendors scattered across the globe. Despite COVID 19 effected marketplace their product is thriving, and they are rapidly growing. They are looking for a Senior IT Support Specialist for their newly acquired location in Houston. This individual will provide technical support and administration to the organization‚Äôs end users and network. The right candidate would be accustomed to resolving a wide range of technology issues while providing top-tier customer service to our end users.  

Role Responsibilities Include:  
‚Ä¢Identifying, diagnosing, tracking, and resolving complex technical problems 
‚Ä¢Working with their third-party implementation partner to manage all integration efforts. 
‚Ä¢Using SCCM to push out changes. 
‚Ä¢Performing basic Systems and Network troubleshooting before escalating issues and facilitating user assistance from third parties or other IT groups as needed 
‚Ä¢Escalating, coordinating, and managing incident response for critical firm-wide issues, leaving proper documentation behind on all incidents 
‚Ä¢Troubleshooting technology issues related to hardware, software, user accounts, LAN/WAN, operating systems, and mobility. 

Required Experience:  
‚Ä¢3+ years of relevant technical support experience- must have  
‚Ä¢Troubleshooting all aspects of mobility, including Windows laptops, MFA solutions, remote connectivity, VPN  
‚Ä¢Troubleshooting and supporting iPhones and iPads  
‚Ä¢Must have experience working with Microsoft Windows and Linux  
‚Ä¢Troubleshooting Microsoft Office software, including Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, OneNote and related add-ins  
‚Ä¢Troubleshooting issues related to Active Directory, DNS, DHCP, Microsoft Exchange, TCP/IP  
‚Ä¢Must have experience supporting basic Windows OS and Network Issues   
‚Ä¢Troubleshooting issues with messaging platforms, collaboration, video conferencing tools (such as WebEx, Zoom, Blue Jeans), and A/V issues 
‚Ä¢Experience supporting any systems integration in a large corporate setting is a HUGE PLUS  

**Manufacturing experience is preferred**
