Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Description of Opportunity:

Are you ready to shape the future? If so, leading students to a better tomorrow could be exactly what you‚Äôre looking for in your next career step. Teaching is a rewarding profession where you can have great influence and continue to make a difference in the world, all while building your professional skill set. It is a profession of possibility. As a teacher, each day presents the promise of possibility. To be a teacher is to be a problem solver, a poet, an inventor, a creator, an explorer, and more. Experience the possibility of untangling a student‚Äôs understanding of numbers, of awakening curiosities that shift life trajectories, and of creating social change. If you want to make a dent in this world, explore your path to teaching.

Teaching is an important and satisfying profession for those who are eternally curious and always looking to innovate. The field of education, now more than ever, is active with debate and exploration about how to make education more effective in preparing our future problem-solvers, from concepts like Personalized Learning to Instructional Leadership, to ideas about the difference between public, private and charter schools, to ways to ensure students are engaged and thrive in distance learning. Thus, as you progress in your career, you‚Äôll have plenty of fodder to keep you stimulated intellectually and challenged professionally.  


Qualifications: 

To be a teacher, you need a few things. 
You need a strong work ethic. As a teacher you‚Äôll work hard, yes, but this is a job where your investment is sure to pay off. For every hour you put in, every exam you administer, every lesson you teach, every pep talk you give, you will reap unparalleled outcomes. Your students will light up when they master the subjects you‚Äôve taught them to love. You‚Äôll establish bonds of trust that allow you to influence their lives. And you‚Äôll get to work with subject matter that interests you. Nobody likes to be bored, but don't worry, you won‚Äôt have that problem.

You need to have high expectations for all students. If you believe that your students can run a NASA command center, manage a corporate boardroom, thrive in a laboratory, master an art studio, succeed in an operating room‚Äîso will they. In the classroom, your influence impacts their dreams and sense of curiosity. Teaching allows you to constantly imagine new and effective ways to reach young minds. 

You need a diverse set of skills: leadership, creative problem-solving, and stellar communication, to name a few more. Simply put, the practice of teaching will naturally help you deepen your talents to increase your influence, impact, and professional abilities. 


How to Apply:

Choosing the right profession is a big deal and TEACH is here to provide you with everything that you might need to determine if teaching is a fit and, if so, where you can find a job once you have your teaching credentials. We‚Äôll help you navigate the different pathways to become a teacher based on the qualifications and experience you already bring to the table. Let us help you make an impact. Visit https://rebrand.ly/crhou and access free and personalized supports as well as scholarship opportunities to pursue the teaching profession.
Other Job Attributes:
compensation: Once certified and hired, starting teaching salaries in Houston are around 50,000

Job Summary

Edwards Transport Services is looking for Company Regional Drivers to service the Texas and Louisiana areas.  You want miles, you got it!  You want to be home weekends with the family, you got it! We have plenty of freight to move Monday - Friday.  We want motivated drivers who want to come to work, service our customers and go home. Reliability and dependability is a plus.

No touch freight hauling 53' & 57' dry vans. Must be prepared to be on the road 3-4 nights of the week.  

-Must Apply in Person

Qualifications and Skills

Must have a Class A CDL.
Driver must have 2 years tractor / trailer experience.
Must be 25 years old or older.
Must have less than 3 moving violations on your record in the past 2 years.
No felonies in the past 10 years.
Must be registered with the Drug and Alcohol Clearinghouse.
Must have ELD experience on a smart phone. 

Benefits

- Consistent miles 
- Home Weekends
- Family Owned Company
- Health/ Aflac, dental, & vision coverage 
- 401k - company match 
- PTO
- Paid holidays
- Uniforms 
- Safety bonus 
- Weekly Direct deposit

Job Description:
One of Houston's top employers is looking for an Email Developer. This is a freelance assignment that starts 10/26.

Position is 40 hours per week.

The Email Developer should have proven experience writing HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. In addition, the Email Developer has strong email responsive coding experience. 

REQUIREMENTS:
+ Bachelor's degree
+ 2-5 years writing HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
+ Understanding of how data is used to target, segment, and personalize campaigns
+ Experience with SQL and Excel
+ Understanding of Photoshop
+ Strong project management skills
+ Attention to detail 

Technical Skills (Expert Level):
+ HTML, CSS

Intermediate Level:
+ AMPscript, XML, JavaScript, SQL
+ Dreamweaver, Photoshop

Experience/Knowledge:
+ Email design and coding
+ Responsive design and coding
+  UX principles
+ Salesforce/ExactTarget Marketing Cloud and Pardot or other Marketing Automation Platform
+ Adobe Creative Suite, HTML/CSS, and PowerPoint
+ 2+ years in Salesforce Marketing Cloud
+ 3+ years producing emails in an agency or in-house creative group

The Email Developer will be responsible for creating and deploying customer-facing emails. 

RESPONSIBILITIES:
+ Build and deploy emails, in-app messages, and push notifications
+ Create and manage email automations and customer lifecycle journeys via FTP list and API-triggers
+ Ensure proper coding

Please formally apply on our website: https://www.tutorbee.com/tutor-application

About TutorBee:

TutorBee is an online tutoring service that provides premiere tutoring in core high school subjects as well as standardized test prep. TutorBee combines the personalized touch of a boutique agency with the opportunities and rate flexibility of online platforms.

Why Apply:

This is an exciting opportunity to join a rising startup in the online education space. We are a company founded and run by premiere NYC tutors, focused on creating the very best environment for tutors. We know that by attracting the top tutors, we can provide the very best services to students.

As tutors, one of the biggest challenges we faced was connecting with students. On large aggregate tutoring platforms, students have to weed through thousands of different profiles, and top tutors are often looked over and unable to find enough work.

We are doing things differently. We are choosing a very select group of tutors to work with so that we can personally get to know each tutor and provide the best marketing and support. Our client leads personally match each student and tutor, which allows our tutors to spend their time doing what they love‚Äîworking with students‚Äîand leave the marketing and billing to us.

Time Commitment: 

- Our tutors will have complete flexibility over their rate and schedule‚Äîgetting the pay that they deserve while also setting their own availability. 
- Being accepted as a tutor by TutorBee does not guarantee any set number of hours. Student requests will be provided as they become available, and tutors will have the opportunity to accept or decline any opportunities offered.
- Tutors will be required to complete a set number of training sessions before working with students. All training will be paid at the tutor‚Äôs hourly rate.

Qualifications:
- You must be an expert (able to currently score in at least the 90th percentile) in at least one of the subjects below. If we decide to move forward, we will ask you to take an online, proctored proficiency test in the AP or SAT subject you are interested in teaching.
-- SAT + ACT reading comprehension + English grammar
-- SAT + ACT math
-- AP BC Calculus
-- GMAT Quantitative Section
-- LSAT (all sections)
-- AP Level C + SAT Chemistry
-- AP + SAT Biology
-- AP + SAT Physics

- Have a 4-year university degree
- Have stable internet connection
- Be extremely responsive via text and email
- Be personable, engaging, and warm
- Have at least three years of consistent tutoring experience
- Be the best of the best, the type of tutor that students remember forever. We are looking for tutors who have years of experience tutoring or teaching, one who students love working with, and who help students see steady improvement in grades and test scores.

Please formally apply on our website: https://www.tutorbee.com/tutor-application

Our fast-growing company is searching for an experienced Maintenance Supervisor who is reliable and has a great eye for detail. The Maintenance Supervisor will work with the Property Manager daily to ensure excellent customer service is being provided to our residents. They will be responsible for the overall maintenance, supervising and mentoring the maintenance team, and preservation for the property.

Our Property Management Corporation acquires, develops and manages multifamily housing properties across the country. We have a proven track record for re-positioning failed or failing properties, and significantly increasing the livability, desirability and profitability of the apartment communities we manage. Our professionals are dedicated to developing and managing high-quality living environments that deliver consistently high rates of return. We recognize the contributions of our teams and welcome individual perspectives that drive the long- term development of our organization.

Principal Duties and Responsibilities

Work with Property Manager and Regional Maintenance Director on property maintenance plans and initiatives
Recruit, supervise and train the maintenance technician(s) and/or groundskeeper(s)
Perform daily property walk
Inspect and maintain building systems (heating, ventilation, etc.)
Ensure the condition of property grounds is clean, safe, and cleared of any debris, trash, or weather-related matters. Report any suspicious activity immediately
Proactively fix and repair items as identified and as reported by residents
Complete and log quarterly preventative maintenance
Respond quickly to deficiencies found in preventative maintenance inspections
Prepping apartments for make-ready turns within 3-5 days
Monitor inventory of materials and equipment
Communicate with vendors and contractors for services needed, including capital improvement projects
Ensure effectively and timely follow up with residents, vendors, and property management team on all maintenance services provided
Respond to all on-call emergencies. Contact resident within 15 minutes of receiving a call and provide ETA not to exceed 1 hour
Respond to all maintenance requests within 24 hours
Follow up on all open, unresolved tickets
Always maintain a friendly and professional demeanor, particularly in stressful situations
Report any resident issues to the Property Manager
Experience, Skills, and Abilities Required

Must have 3-5 years of maintenance experience with a multi-family /residential property and 1-2 years in a supervisor capacity
HVAC certification is required
CPO Certificate preferred or ability to obtain within first 90 days of employment
Must have basic set of tools
In-depth knowledge of general maintenance processes and methods
Applicable knowledge of tools, standard appliances, and devices
Manual dexterity and attention to detail
Problem-solving ability
Must be responsible and reliable
Courteous and professional always
Remain calm under pressure
Valid Driver‚Äôs License required

- You CANNOT have a family history of clinical depression or mental illness
- You must have at least 1 semester of college/trade school or be pursuing a successful modeling/acting/musical/art career
- You must be height/weight proportionate (BMI must be less than 27)

I am also searching for a few other potential candidates for clients of other ethnic backgrounds so if you think you would be a good fit for egg donation, I would love to hear from you.

Things You Should Know:
* Being a donor does NOT cause infertility
* You will need to go to about 6-8 doctor's appointments in a 2-month time frame (paid for by the client)
* The process should not be painful and you should be able to go back to work/school the day after your retrieval
* You can live anywhere in the United States and be a donor
* Being a donor will not cost you anything out of pocket
Other Job Attributes:
compensation: Up to $12K for the right candidate!

We are looking for a skilled Accounting Clerk to perform a variety of accounting, bookkeeping and financial tasks. Accounting Clerk responsibilities include keeping financial records updated, preparing reports and reconciling bank statements. You will run accounting software programs to process business transactions, like accounts payable and receivable, disbursements, expense vouchers and receipts. A successful accounting assistant should be familiar with all accounting procedures and have a flair for numbers. Inform management and compile reports/summaries on activity areas

Constantly update job knowledge
Skills

Proven accounting experience, preferably as an Accounts receivable clerk or Accounts payable clerk
Familiarity with bookkeeping and basic accounting procedures
Competency in MS Office, databases and accounting software
Hands-on experience with spreadsheets and financial reports
Accuracy and attention to detail
Aptitude for numbers
Ability to perform filing and record-keeping tasks
Data entry and word processing skills
Well organized
High school degree
Associate‚Äôs degree or relevant certification is a plus

$2,600 a month + Commissions - If you have an insurance License or Experienced in selling Auto Insurance.

Monday to Friday 9-7

Sunday OFF

INSURANCE AGENT and OFFICE MANAGER POSITION

Must be good at sales, we will get you licensed as an insurance: You will be selling insurance, making changes on customers polices, taking customers payments, and quoting new customers. You will also manage your own office by yourself or with another co-worker.

You do not need to have experience in the field , you just need to have a very good attitude, be a fast learner, reliable and great at sales.
Serious people looking for long term careers ONLY as we are looking for long-term employees.

‚Ä¢ You will be working in an office environment.
‚Ä¢ Must be a Fast learner.
‚Ä¢ Must be good at problem solving.
‚Ä¢ Must be able to concentrate and be on a computer for most of the day.
‚Ä¢ This is for people looking for a career and long-term opportunity not short term.

‚Ä¢ Good people skills.
‚Ä¢ Upbeat attitude.
‚Ä¢ Be able to problem solve.
‚Ä¢ Be good under pressure.
‚Ä¢ Computer literate (How to Print, Copy, Scan, Search Desktop)
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
BENEFITS AND BONUS STRUCTURE:

‚Ä¢ Medical, Dental, and Vision: (Offered after being with the company for 60 days) We pay 50% and you pay 50%.
‚Ä¢ Vacation Time off: After you are with us for one year, we offer paid vacation every six months.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

JOB TITLE AND JOB DESCRIPTION:
INSURANCE AGENT and OFFICE MANAGER POSITION

Must be good at sales, we will get you licensed as an insurance: You will be selling insurance, making changes on customers polices, taking customers payments, and quoting new customers. You will also manage your own office by yourself or with another co-worker.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

‚Ä¢ Must speak both English & Spanish.
‚Ä¢ Good people skills.
‚Ä¢ Upbeat attitude.
‚Ä¢ Be able to problem solve.
‚Ä¢ Be good under pressure.

Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


We are looking for energetic, positive individuals to work as online instructors (tutors) for  Lindamood-Bell¬Æ Learning Processes. We teach students of all ages to read and comprehend to their potential, including those with a previous diagnosis such as dyslexia or autism spectrum disorder.

Lindamood-Bell instruction is implemented by instructors we call Clinicians, under the guidance of Learning Center instructional leaders utilizing our co-founders' evidence-based programs.  Clinicians work with students individually, or in small group settings, implementing specific lesson plans for reading, language comprehension, and math. They may also facilitate curriculum for students enrolled in our private school, Lindamood-Bell Academy.

These positions are seasonal. Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, screening and interviewing will be conducted remotely via Zoom or phone. Paid training in the programs used by Lindamood-Bell will be provided remotely as well.  At this time, instruction will be conducted remotely from your home. Your work location may transition to in-center instruction in the future.  Required hours during the paid training are generally 8 hours per day, Monday through Friday, for two weeks.  Following the training, as a seasonal employee, your hours may vary week-to-week according to instructional needs. 

Lindamood-Bell Instructor Expectations:
‚Ä¢	Utilize a Socratic questioning method to help students develop their language and literacy skills.
‚Ä¢	Implement positive-reinforcement strategies that maximize learning in a cheerful and authentic manner.
‚Ä¢	Possess excellent reading, spelling, and comprehension skills.
‚Ä¢	Possess strong computer skills and the ability to type notes about student performance while leading engaging sessions.
‚Ä¢	Have a passion for helping others reach their potential.

 Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢	Provide one-to-one and/or small group instruction online, based upon each client‚Äôs learning needs.
‚Ä¢	Work with the Center Director or Center Manager, Associate Center Director, and Consultants to implement client instruction plans.
‚Ä¢	Facilitate the use of curriculum provided for Lindamood-Bell Academy students.
‚Ä¢	Interact positively and professionally with clients and staff to provide a safe and positive learning environment.
‚Ä¢	Use provided technology to facilitate online instruction and manage client records. 

Remote Work Requirements:
‚Ä¢	Strong and reliable internet connection required. Offers of employment will be contingent upon passing the Company‚Äôs required internet speed test.
‚Ä¢	Ability to use equipment such as headphones, document camera, webcam, laptops/Chromebooks to engage and instruct clients. Lindamood-Bell will provide all the necessary computer equipment.
‚Ä¢	Availability of  a workspace that meets Lindamood-Bell show standards: desk or table, simple background, adequate lighting, uninterrupted by sound or other people/pets.

Benefits:
We believe in the importance of investing in our employees so all members of our Star Cast can succeed to their potential. Eligibility for insurance benefits, discounts, and additional perks varies with employment level, location, and may be subject to additional terms and conditions. 

If you become part of our Star Cast, here are possible benefits for which you can be eligible:
‚Ä¢	Employees in some states may be eligible for sick pay.
‚Ä¢	Employees who meet specific criteria may be eligible for a 401(k).
‚Ä¢	Company-wide discounts on many services and products including Apple products, cell phones, and auto rental deals.

About Us:
Lindamood-Bell is an internationally recognized leader in the field of education. Our Learning Centers are located in the United States, Australia, Singapore, Hong Kong, and the United Kingdom.  In addition to our learning centers, we provide professional development to educators around the world. Over the years we have partnered with institutions including the University of Washington, the University of Alabama at Birmingham, MIT, Wake Forest University, and Georgetown University, to allow for independent analysis of our instruction. Our work has been recognized by the U.S. Department of Education and has been reviewed in scientific journals such as Nature, Neuron, and NeuroImage.  Reporting on our success has appeared in Newsweek, US News, and World Report, CNN, BBC, and PBS, among others.

For more information, we invite you to visit our website at LindamoodBell.com.

To Apply:
Please apply directly at https://lindamoodbell-openhire.silkroad.com/epostings/index.cfm?fuseaction=app.jobinfo&jobid=1686

Lindamood-Bell is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status. Lindamood-Bell Learning Processes follows applicable requirements regarding applicants with criminal histories.

QR Code Link to This Post


CDL A Oilfield Truck Driver

Walter Resource Partners provides an exceptional high level of care for its drivers and has been recognized numerous times throughout Texas Magazines. We have a well-respected staff and use cutting edge equipment.

WRP is an essential business to its customers and communities, our team is working hard to keep supply chains up and running. We are committed to the health and safety to our associates, candidates and customers. We have modified out hiring process to include increased phone interviews and where in-person activities are required.

At WR Partners, we have created something special: A better place to work and grow. We provide top-notch training and a clear career path. We are a re-shaped, re-energized brand of honesty, transparency and accountability. In the rise to becoming a true leader in transportation and logistics, we continue to ‚Äòdeliver the dream‚Äô to our employees and customers. 

We are looking for drivers to haul: heavy equipment, frac equipment, sand, chemicals, fuel, crude and much more!!!

**Please Call/Text the Hiring Manager's number attached to this ad (reference: CDL Oilfield Job) for immediate response**

POSITION: CDL A Oilfield Truck Driver
This position is responsible for hauling product for our customers in the oil and gas industry.
The position will also be responsible for mentoring and assisting in training. 
Will drive and operate equipment for our customers on dedicated wells. 
Responsible for driving and operating trucks and equipment in/out the field. 
Utilizes information gathered from calculations/ratios/or other factors in the field to adjust to situations and understands consequences to actions.

POSITION REQUIREMENTS: 
Must have a Class A CDL license and a current DOT medical card. 
Must have a minimum of two (2) years CDL A or B driving experience.
Must be a minimum of twenty-three (23) years of age.
Must have experience with manual transmissions.
Must be able to drive truck off-road and on roads that are narrow and rough terrain. 
Must be able to effectively navigate a computer, cell phone and tablet. 
Basic knowledge of computer systems.

COMPENSATION:
Up to $2,500 per week earning potential.
All drivers are compensated weekly.
Holiday bonuses (every year).
Currently working on new appreciation bonus.
FREE HOUSING

SCHEDULE/HOURS: 
Employee can pick his/her own schedule.
6 days on, 1 day off.
2 weeks on, 1 week off.
3 weeks on, 1 week off.
Day and night schedules available. 

BENEFITS:
Healthcare provided: Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance.
Each employee has multiple Medical plans to choose from (depending on family needs).
Provided by company: Life Insurance, short-term/long-term disability.
Fuel card provided, discounts at the pump for food, drinks and store items.
Vacation: provided to drivers with supervisor approval.
401(k) Retirement: match will be back by 2021.
HOUSING: FREE HOUSING!!!!!

Join Us, Apply Now!

**Please Call/Text the Hiring Manager's number attached to this ad (reference: CDL Oilfield Job) for immediate response**

Send in your resume to Careers @ WalterRP.com OR Apply https://www.WalterRP.com/Careers 

Walter Resource Partners is an Equal Opportunity Employer

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation or protected veteran status. Successful completion of company pre-employment background check, drug screen, Motor Vehicle Record review, and other related testing upon job offer acceptance.

Dominium is one of the nation‚Äôs largest and fastest growing developers, owners, and managers of affordable housing. Our core mission is to provide residents with clean, safe, well-maintained, and affordable housing at an outstanding value.
We are currently seeking a Maintenance Technician to join our team at Villa Springs, a 216 unit apartment community in Houston, TX.
In addition to the hourly rate, a sign on bonus of $1,500 minus taxes will be included! ($750 after 30 days of employment; $750 after 6 months of employment)

Position Summary:
As a Maintenance Technician, you will be responsible for the general appearance and maintenance of the physical property.
Responsibilities:
Monitor property for needed repairs and replacements
Complete work requests for common areas and apartment units
Perform preventative maintenance
Troubleshoot and repair appliances as needed
Prepare vacant apartments for turnover
Be on-call as scheduled by management
Create and maintain a safe work environment Qualifications:
1 - 2 years previous experience in maintenance preferred¬†
Basic knowledge of electrical systems, plumbing systems, and painting
HVAC and EPA experience preferred
CPO certification preferred
Boiler License preferred
Yardi software experience preferred
Ability to work occasional evenings and weekends as needed
Valid drivers' license and insurance required 
About Us:¬†Dominium manages more than 30,000 apartments in 19 states with a staff of more than 1,200 employees.¬†As long-term owners, we have been committed to providing housing solutions for more than four decades. We are a vibrant and growing organization, with many avenues and opportunities for you to build a successful career.
We offer a competitive salary, incentive bonus program, career growth opportunities, training and development programs, and a community volunteer and outreach program. Our comprehensive benefits package for eligible employees includes medical, dental, vision, paid time off, education, 401(k), employee recognition, wellness programs, rent discounts for employees living on a Dominium property, and more!

JOB DESCRIPTION
Support the Senox branch team to attain the highest level of customer service by being the best.

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR
A warehouse ninja who can make our service sing & dance. If you are a motivated get it done kind of person we want you on our team. Slackers call our competitors and go to work for them. We're looking for people to kick customer service into high gear so we can continue to win the competitive race. Do you want to win also? Come join us. We will train you in the distribution art we are practicing.

WHAT THE IDEAL TEAM PLAYER WILL HAVE
The ability to work effectively with others and loves to add value to a likeminded group endeavor
A sense of energy, passion, honesty, good attendance, and personal responsibility
Skills to say and do the right things to help teammates feel appreciated, understood, and included
Little ego when it comes to needing attention, credit, and is comfortable sharing accolades
Persistence, dedication, organization, and commitment to a task well done
Passion to do work that matters and not just looking for a J-O-B
Desire to see their work impact future generations and a willingness to mentor others
Strong communication and technical skills in order translate business needs into results

SKILLS AND REQUIREMENTS
Able to add, subtract, multiply, and divide with a calculator
Ability to operate a delivery pickup truck and backup with a 20' trailer attached
Ability to effectively communicate with customers by phone and in person
Basic understanding of warehouse operations, and safety rules
Must be able to stand, walk, stoop, kneel, and climb
Must be able to lift 50 pounds individually and team lift 100 pounds throughout a workday
Willingness to operate a forklift and pallet jack after training
Ability to manage multiple functions at one time
Valid Driver's License and good driving record
Bilingual (English/Spanish) a plus
Handle petty cash as needed

A FEW THINGS WE WANT YOU TO KNOW
We have approximately 300 team players and we're growing!
Our interview process is more thorough and involved because we are looking for the right fit.
We work really hard, we love what we do, at the end of the day we go home and enjoy our families.
We are looking for people who have a successful personal life, they make good team players.
We cultivate a pleasant winning environment using the principles of Humble, Hungry, & Smart.

Salary: $16.43 /hour

Job Title: Growth Stage Edtech Startup Hiring Full Stack Engineers
Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


PrepScholar's mission is to improve education at scale through technology. Our SAT/ACT prep program learns the strengths and weaknesses of each student and creates an individualized learning program through machine learning. It also motivates students to study through clear structure and behavioral feedback. You can think of it as an automated tutor that provides a compelling learning experience at scale. We also have a large organic content project with over a million monthly visitors to our free tools and articles. We believe we have a major advantage over other companies in our space because of our technology-centered and analytical approach to education.

You'll join PrepScholar as a full stack engineer and work on projects to grow our company within test prep and beyond. You'll improve our prep program by building new features, using large datasets to iterate on A/B tests, and scaling to handle thousands of users. You'll develop free tools and data presentations to give millions of families worldwide better information to guide their decisions. You'll be a core part of our growth as we scale to becoming a national education brand.

We're a team of 10+ and growing, and we're based in Cambridge, MA next to the Charles River. Check us out at www.prepscholar.com

Skills & Requirements
We're looking for a generalist who enjoys learning and working with different technologies along the stack.

Our stack:
Sass, JQuery, Backbone
Django/Python
MySQL
AWS/Linux

Requirements:
+Strong foundation in computer science and software engineering, including competencies in data structures, algorithms, databases, software design and dev ops.

+Strong hands-on experience with our core technologies is a big plus. In particular:

+Python and Django

+JavaScript and JavaScript MV* frameworks like AngularJS, Ember, Knockout, or Backbone

Ideal candidate has:
+Experience deploying frequently

+Willingness to try new things and pick up new technologies quickly

+UX intuition and an eye for design

+Ability to work independently with low management overhead

+Excitement about startups in growth mode and about our company mission

+Location in Boston or willingness to relocate (Full WFH during COVID; partial WFH options after)

About Us
+Founded in 2013. We're profitable, growing, and bootstrapped, so you'll have stability and ability to build out a long-term vision.

+We have a lot of room to grow within test prep and education at large.

+We have a team of 20 full-time members and more part-time instructors.

+We have thousands of customers and a growing footprint of millions of visitors.

+We care about culture and a great work environment. We're flexible with schedule, have no scheduled overtime, conduct efficient meetings, and want minimal bureaucracy.

+Our office is in Cambridge on River Street. We have parking available and we're walking distance from the Central Square Red Line stop.

Why Join Us?
+You'll be an early engineer with an impact on company direction and culture.

+We offer competitive salary with perks like a new work machine, free catered daily lunch, drinks/snacks, and tools you need to be productive.

+We offer relocation assistance.

+You'll be building something meaningful. Education is a linchpin of our country's economy and empowers people to improve their own lives. For many reasons, education suffers throughout the country -- class sizes too large, methods outdated, teachers underpaid. Here's your chance to build a scalable solution that actually has impact.

Tired of performing all the work yourself?  
Tired of professional life and want to try something different?  
Looking to join a team that can support your own client growth goals?
Tired of running your own business?

Keep reading...to see if joining our team is right for you.

This position is to expand our already strong team of project managers that manage our growing client base.  A strong ability to understand how to do the work is a must in this business.  You must first prove you can do the work before we transition you to full-time sales and management.  Applicants must be willing to get their hands dirty as they grow with the company.

Bonus Eligible

Pay Period: Every 2 Weeks
Current Company Sales >$1,000,000.00

Ability to work 12 hour shifts.
Must be able to communicate effectively on the phone.
Must be organized in tracking expenses and paperwork as well as call logs and customer requests.
A desire to work independently and on your own as your own boss.
A desire to grow employees in their skills as well as utilize their employees to their potential.
Experienced in management of company operations (employee management, customer management, employee discipline, scheduling jobs/customers, order materials, send invoices, create estimates, be on time to appointments).
A drive to succeed both in your professional careers and in your personal life.
A desire to partner with a growing leader in the home services business including but not limited to Landscaping and Handyman.

A keen focus on customer service.
A willing attitude to do what needs to be done, whenever it arises

Willingness to perform work as needed to get the job done to customer satisfaction.
Must handle difficult issues with customer with calmness and integrity.
Ability to schedule multiple jobs in a day and check up on the job and customers on a daily basis.
Ability to call customers and collect money on past due balances.
Ability to schedule work with customers without double booking employees or subcontractors.
Must be able to speak English fluently
Ability to learn electronic devices such as iPhone and iPads, along with laptops.
Ability to learn basic functions on QuickBooks or computer programs alike.
Excellent driving record.
No Felonies in past 10 years
Must have own transportation and small hand tools.
Proficient at Typing to a rate of 30 WPM
Ability to quickly learn and effectively use online database systems, such as Service Auto Pilot.

The Machinery Rigger position prepares and assists in the disassembly, rigging, moving, securing and re-installation of machinery. Assist in the loading, securing and unloading of machinery from company or common carrier trailers. Be adept in the procedures necessary to safely and efficiently perform these functions with the proper equipment and materials such as forklifts, skates, jacks, slings, chains, shackles, etc. Operate company equipment and vehicles in a safe manner. Serve as an effective and responsible member of a team to accomplish the tasks above. Position responsibilities include: Dismantle equipment when required for repair or transportation and reassemble it at the appropriate time; Selects cables, ropes, chains, pulleys, winches, blocks, and sheaves, according to weight and size of load to be moved. Moves machinery and equipment, using hoists, dollies, rollers, and trucks; while avoiding contamination or workplace safety hazards; Assembles machinery and bolts, welds, rivets, or otherwise fastens them to foundation or other structures, using hand tools and power tools.

THERE IS A REASON WHY OUR DRIVER TURN OVER IS SO LOW.

Requirements 
- High school diploma or GED equivalent 
- Prefer 1+ year of experience. 
- Prior manufacturing experience is preferred.
- Able to lift 10-15 lbs. continuously and lift up to 50+/- lbs. occasionally
- Use hands/wrists/shoulders continuously in controlled movement
- Proficient understanding of computers and phone/mobile devices (used for inventory management) 
- Physically able to bend, lift and move around and stand for entirety of shift.
- Read a ruler accurately down to 1/8‚Äù at minimum but prefer down to 1/32‚Äù 
- Comfortable with a detailed process and working at a very fast pace
- MUST pass drug and background check 

Compensation DOE

D&A Deliveries LLC is seeking dependable and efficient CDL truck drivers who thrive working long hours on the road and can consistently ensure safe and accurate deliveries. 

As a truck driver, freedom is one of your most important benefits. You‚Äôll have the ability to travel the open road safely and not be stuck in a cubicle all day. Enjoy your freedom and the incredibly stable sense of job security on the open road! 

With over 30years of combined trucking experience, we value our drivers and offer competitive pay of $.60/mile AND bonus incentives (such as passing DOT inspections). 
Come work for a company that actually cares and supports their drivers by offering a respectful, open collaborative team of managers!

CDL Truck Driver Job Duties and Responsibilities
‚Ä¢	Pick-up and safely transport goods to intended destination
‚Ä¢	Ensure contents are properly secured in a truck, flatbed to prevent damage/injury
‚Ä¢	Obtain signatures to confirm and complete deliveries
‚Ä¢	Assist in mapping driving routes
‚Ä¢	Stay on a predetermined route and ensure timely transport and delivery
‚Ä¢	Communicate with dispatch as needed
‚Ä¢	Confirm that the contents of each shipment load matches the manifest document
‚Ä¢	Perform inspections of your vehicle prior to and following each trip
‚Ä¢	Check weather conditions and road reports before departure
‚Ä¢	Always ensure your vehicle is kept clean
‚Ä¢	Report maintenance and service requests for vehicle as needed (refuel, change oil, tire pressure, repairs, etc.)
‚Ä¢	Notify managers of any major maintenance or delivery issues encountered
‚Ä¢	Follow delivery schedule and rest at appropriate times
‚Ä¢	Maintain detailed driving and delivery logs
‚Ä¢	Track and report working hours
‚Ä¢	Adhere to company rules and regulations
‚Ä¢	Obey all applicable traffic laws and drive in according to the weather/road conditions
‚Ä¢	Comply with DOT regulations
‚Ä¢	Make safety a priority at all times


CDL Truck Driver Requirements and Qualifications
‚Ä¢	High school diploma or GED equivalent preferred
‚Ä¢	Valid commercial driver‚Äôs license (CDL) required
‚Ä¢	2+ years of proven experience in commercial truck driving preferred	
‚Ä¢	Minimum 3weeks over the road experience
‚Ä¢	Skilled at driving and parking large, heavy vehicles
‚Ä¢	Alert, focused, and detail-oriented
‚Ä¢	Physically and mentally fit

(criminal background acceptable on case by case basis)

Job Title: Service Tech I for Luxury Apartments!
Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post



We are looking for an experienced Service Tech I for Memorial by Windsor, a luxury apartment community conveniently located in Houston, TX. 


At Windsor Communities, it's all about people. Our residents depend on us to be observant, interested in their lives, and quick to respond to their needs. We enjoy working with them and with each other. Every day is different: rewarding, challenging, and fun. Join an environment where your team becomes your family and your profession becomes your passion. As a Windsor Service Tech I, you have a dedication that cannot be beat. You are hardworking, self-motivated, and take pride in a job well-done. Does this sound like you? Click here to apply today and you can #WorkatWindsor!

Day to Day - the nitty, but not gritty:Respond to maintenance issues, follow-up with residents and office staff, and handle routine issues for appliances, pools, and building upkeep.Be a valuable member of the maintenance team, and be responsible for checking, troubleshooting, and making routine repairs.Resolve any maintenance issues including: appliances, air conditioning, heating, electrical, plumbing, carpentry, pools, and other building items.Responsible for compliance with all OSHA regulations and any applicable laws in your area, regarding health, safety, or environment, as well as budget and key control.Work directly and consistently with residents to analyze and resolve issues.Resolve issues in a timely and efficient manner, with a sense of urgency and customer focus.Your skills - show us what you got:Experience in apartment and/or residential maintenance.Excellent communication skills and professional appearance to work with our high-end residents.Individual must be AC qualified and able to read wiring diagrams.High level of competency and efficiency in all aspects of maintenance operations (pool, appliance, HVAC, electrical, carpentry, etc.)Capable of performing sustained manual labor.May require overtime, holiday, and weekend work.Requires ownership of hand tools.Ability to work in inclement weather.Great time management skills.Our Commitment to You - our greatest asset:Windsor is a growing company that fosters a professional attitude and a strong team spirit. We are committed to training our employees well, honoring their achievements, and promoting from within. The people who work here are outgoing, caring, and proud of what they do. If you're someone who welcomes responsibility and enjoys getting involved, you'll fit right in!Drug testing and background checks are an employment requirement. Upon submission of your application, you will be invited to complete the Infor Talent Science Assessment. These are required steps in the hiring process.

Windsor Communities provides training, mentoring, growth, and advancement opportunities for our valued associates. Start your career with Windsor now! Click here to apply!Check us out on Glassdoor.

compensation: competitive salary, benefits, show allowance, housing discount

QR Code Link to This Post


Are you a heavy sweater? You may suffer from hyperhidrosis.
We are conducting a clinical research study evaluating an investigational topical gel for patients
with axillary hyperhidrosis (excessive underarm sweating).
About this study:
- It is an 11 to 15 week study with 13 clinic visits.
- Participants will have an equal chance of receiving either the clinical research drug or a
placebo. Results may vary.
- Participants will receive compensation for time and travel.
- Participants must be exhibiting symptoms of axillary hyperhidrosis for at least 6 months.
- Participants must be available for morning appointments between 7-11am.
- Participants must be ages 9+.
- Participants must not be pregnant or breastfeeding.
Participants may be helping¬†millions of other hyperhidrosis sufferers nationwide just by being a
part of this clinical research study.
Visit https://cardgian.sweat2much.com/prequalify to learn more and prequalify for the trial.

Job Title: HOUSTON = Delivery, Courier - must have Cargo Van, Box Truck
Location: South Houston I-45 = 10min S of downtown
Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


South Houston - Delivery, Courier - Cargo Van, Suburban or Box Truck

Prefer independent couriers. We need to always be able to call you during the day shift.

Our old courier has moved and we have about 100 runs per year from our South Houston warehouse which is on I-45 in South Houston.      

Today we have a casket picking up at our warehouse at 1301 Missouri Street, South Houston, TX  77587.  We have a delivery going to San Antonio, TX 173 miles away.  Normally we would pay $120 to $160 for this one.         First one that calls gets it.   You can call us at 866-474-50 six one Now. We take calls up until midnight. 

Those giving us bids are usually independent couriers, retires and other people with flexible schedules. 

We are the biggest shipper of boxed EMPTY caskets in the USA. We need a low priced dependable courier for the area. We normally have about 60-100 shipments per year from IAH. We let you know 1 day ahead of time on each shipment. 

Part Time Delivery, Courier - must have own Box Truck, Suburban, Cargo Van.

The caskets measure 86" long x 30" wide x 24" high. The airport will load the box containing the empty casket into your vehicle. The funeral home will wheel an adjustable height dolly up to the back of your vehicle. You will then push the casket out onto the dolly and they will wheel the casket into the funeral home. Get a signoff and you are done. Only one person is necessary. You do not have to lift the casket. 

 Sometimes we will have long deliveries up to 400 miles away. If you are not available for these, that is ok.

 Please send us a table like below or you can call us:

0-10 miles = $35
11-20mile = $45 
31- 40 miles $55
41-100 miles $1/mile
Over 100 miles = $0.75/mile


Please call us with your prices. Remember, many others will be bidding on this job today and future shipments so give us your best price.

We pay by Paypal, credit card but most companies just bill us. We pay usually 1 or 2 days from delivery. Your choice. 

 So what are your RATES, PHONE NUMBER, EMAIL ADDRESS and NAME? This is a Part Time Job. We let you know 1 day ahead of time on each delivery. 


 First one that calls gets it. You can call us at 866-474-50 six one NOW! 

 BestPriceCaskets.com
Other Job Attributes:
compensation: over 40 miles = $1.20/mile with $55 minimum

Job Title: Earn $300/Day. BOX TRUCK OWNER OPERATORS NEEDED. BE YOUR OWN BOSS
Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


BOX TRUCK OWNER OPERATOR - NO TOUCH FREIGHT

Wobi is looking for independent owner operators of box trucks. This is a no touch freight position. Be your own boss and earn great pay. Get paid up to $300 per day. You will not have to lift a single item. Help customers relocate to their new apartment, homes or office. Average jobs are 15miles away, so you can get home in time for lunch or dinner. Help customers relocate and put smiles on customers faces. You bring the truck, Wobi will find the helpers, and you don't do the hard work. Helpers drive their own cars, so no strangers in your truck.


HOW IT WORKS

1. Set your schedule on our website
2. Checkout our load board and select the jobs your prefer.
3. Drive to the customers house, apartment or office.
4. We will send Wobi helpers to drive and meetup with you at the customers location.
5. Relax, eat, watch a movie while Wobi helpers load up the customers items in your truck.
6. When they are done, secure the items safely for transport.
7. Drive to the drop-off location. Relax while Wobi helpers unload the truck.
8. Get PAID.


REQUIREMENTS

1. Own or Lease a 16ft TO 26ft Box truck ( No rental trucks allowed)
2. $300,000 auto liability Insurance or higher
3. $10,000 cargo insurance or higher
4. Have an active USDOT


HOW TO JOIN

1. Fill out our short application form at http://jobs.gowobi.com/earn
2. Get a call from our onboarding team 15minutes after filling the form
3. Read and sign our independent contractor agreement.
4. Start accepting jobs as soon as the next day!!




CALL NOW: 832-663-0245
APPLY NOW: http://jobs.gowobi.com/earn

Job Title: Foreign Currency Trader - Finance, Part Time, Remote - Work From Home
Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Top-ranked proprietary trading firm, Maverick Trading, is searching for entrepreneurially-minded, profit-driven people to be trained in the art and science of proprietary trading in its online foreign exchange trading division, Maverick FX.  Successful candidates will trade foreign currencies with the firm's capital on behalf of the firm and reap the majority share of the profits.

As one of the best proprietary Forex trading firms in the industry, Maverick FX offers its traders impressive capital and leverage, comprehensive training, and extensive support and mentoring.  We teach our traders how to trade in the Forex market.  Maverick FX's capital base, training, and reputation has allowed us to partner with the top currency trading broker to offer our traders tighter spreads and better execution than the typical retail Forex firm.

The Forex market is open 23-1/2 hours a day, five days a week.  This time horizon allows the firm to offer its traders flexible hours and the ability to start part-time and transition into full-time trading.  Prop forex trading is a mentally engaging, challenging profession where diligence and consistency translate directly into financial reward.  In other words, this is truly meaningful work.  The firm's traders have the opportunity to practice their craft from anywhere in the world via high-speed internet.

---About Maverick Trading FX Division---

Started in 1997, Maverick Trading is one of the most experienced prop trading firms and is ranked as one of the top trading companies in the industry, accepting and funding experienced traders as well as teaching motivated people from all backgrounds how to become traders.  The firm's Maverick FX Division has been actively trading the Forex markets since 2009.  As a result of a long track record of success, the firm has the capital to back and fund its traders with meaningful amounts of capital.

Each trader starts live trading with a minimum of a $10,000 account ($500,000 in buying power) and keeps 70% to 80% of trading profits.  As you gain experience and demonstrate consistent profitability you become eligible for greater amounts of the firm's capital.  Our top traders can trade up to $300,000 ($15 million in buying power).  Profitable traders are also eligible for Performance Bonuses.

---How to Apply---

Our application process is multi-step and designed to educate you on prop trading, how we train, support and fund our traders, and how we pay out profits to you, as well as focus you for your interview where you can have any remaining questions answered and discuss with your recruiter why Maverick FX is a good fit for you.
To get started, click on the application link below.  This will take you to a short video that will discuss Maverick FX and its Capital Sharing Program (how you get funded and paid).

When you complete the application process, you will be contacted by one of our experienced recruiters (who are also traders themselves) for a Suitability Interview.

CLICK on the link below to begin the application process:

https://maverickfx.com/maverick-trading/apply/fx-division/?utm_source=clfxwedhouston

If you're interested in trading the markets at a professional level, whether part-time, full-time, or in a transitional or supplementary income capacity, it pays to start with one of the best prop trading firms in the industry.  

We look forward to speaking with you and exploring if you'll be the next great trader to join us.

Cheers,

The Maverick FX Team

Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Apply Now







For more than 75 years, Grifols has worked to improve the health and well-being of people around the world. We are a global healthcare company that produces essential plasma-derived medicines for patients and provides hospitals and healthcare professionals with the tools, information and services they need to deliver expert medical care.







Medical Support Technician (EMT-B)
Summary:
Under the supervision of the Medical/Laboratory Director and Center Management ensure donor suitability, product integrity and the continued good health of donors through the compliance with Food and Drug Administration (FDA) regulations and Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) Manual guidelines.
Primary Responsibilities for Role:
Promote customer satisfaction through appropriate interaction and responsiveness to customer needs.
Selection of suitable plasmapheresis donors by performing physical examinations and taking medical histories on all donors through the use of FDA approved Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) Manual (with particular detailed attention to communications related to AIDS information and plasmapheresis informed consent) current State and Federal requirements, OSHA, CLIA, CGMP, all internal company all internal company procedures and personal education and experience.
Trained to perform all duties and responsibilities of a Donor Center Technician.
Performs evaluations of any history of illness or medications to ensure continued donor suitability. . Ensures Donor medical information is complete and accurate prior to donation.
Responsible for donor awareness to potential hazards.
Administration of donor consent form.
Builds rapport with donors to ensure overall customer satisfaction with the center to support long term donation.
Maintain supplies necessary to perform job duties.
Maintains and ensures proper sanitation and cleaning of equipment and work areas between donors.
Ensures Donor and Staff confidentiality
Reports all unsafe situations or conditions to Center Management.
Performs other duties as required.
 Additional Responsibilities:
Works under direct supervision until fully trained and then general supervision. Handles all donor screening processes and assists in the performance of physical exams, administration of consent and suitability decisions. Reviews complex cases with Medical Operations Supervisor or Medical Director. May assist with company research trials.
 Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Good assessment skills with ability to handle cases. Excellent Customer Service skills. Good understanding of both verbal and written English. Where applicable written and verbal bi-lingual skills. Ability to understand and follow SOPs and protocols. The ability to work in a high paced highly regulated environment. Following strict protocols in regards to audits and detailed documentation. Computer proficient in word processing programs.
Education
Educated and currently certified/licensed in the state of employment and according to state requirements as an Emergency Medical Technician Basic or Intermediate. Current CPR certification required.
Experience
Typically requires no related experience. Experience with plasma or whole blood in a medical or cGMP regulated environment preferred.
Equivalency
Depending on the area of assignment, directly related experience or a combination of directly related education and experience and/or competencies may be considered in place of the stated requirements.
Occupational Demands
Occupational Demands Form # 71: Work is performed in a plasma center. Exposure to biological fluids with potential exposure to infectious organisms. Exposure to electrical office and laboratory equipment. Exposure to extreme cold below 32 degrees F while working in plasma freezer. Personal protective equipment required such as protective eyewear, garments, gloves and cold-gear. Work is performed sitting for 4 to 6 hours per day and does require standing, bending and twisting neck and waist for 1-2 hours per day. Frequent hand movement of both hands with the ability to make fast, simple, movements of the fingers, hands, and wrists. Ability to make precise coordinated movements, of the fingers to grasp and manipulate objects. Frequent foot movement; may infrequently squat, crouch or sit on one's heels. May walk up to 1-2 hours per day. Light lifting of 15lbs. with a maximum lift of 50lbs. May reach below shoulder height. Hearing acuity essential. Color perception/discrimination, near vision and far vision correctable in one eye to 20/30 and to 20/100 in the other eye. Able to comprehend and follow instructions to complete assigned tasks. Must possess the ability to listen to and understand information and ideas presented through spoken words and sentences. Must perform within the guidance of both oral and written instructions. Performs a wide range of complex tasks as dictated by variable demands and changing conditions with little predictability as to their occurrence. Relates sensitive information to diverse groups.
EEO Minorities/Women/Disabled/Veterans
 
CLK789 #biomatusa

Location: NORTH AMERICA : USA : TX-Houston:USBEL - Houston TX-W Bellfort-BIO

Job Title: TRAIN TO BECOME A SECURITY OFFICER
Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


TRAINING ACADEMYMed-Security, Inc. Is proud to offer Level II classroom and interactive, online security officer training courses, in addition to Level III security officer training courses. Our virtual class features a real-time instructor whose hands on knowledge will ensure you get the most out of your training. Upon completion students will receive a state recognized certificate to become a security officer in the State of Texas. Our students are also guided through the application completed through the DPS online portal TOPS (Texas Online Private Security).**Please be sure to read our safety guidelines.**
Safety RequirementsFor the safety of our students and staff members we have imposed the following guidelines:
Class size is limited to 4 people per class, with all classes booked in advance AND by appointment only in order to main the 4 person ratio.

Classes will take place in our conference room in order to maintain social distancing. Entrance/ exit will also be regulated.

Students and staff alike will be required to wear a face covering at all times.

Anyone appearing sick or exhibiting signs of illness will not be allowed to participate in class.

Med Security reserves the right to conduct temperature checks if desired.

TPSB Level 2 Non-Commission Security (Unarmed Security) Training Course(online or in classroom by appointment only)General Course Description
Responsibilities of a Security Officer
Roles of a Security Officer
Areas of Responsibility
Prevention and¬†Deterrence
Relations with Local Police
Observation and Report Writing
Authority to Question and Basis for Making Decisions
Price: 
$60 (4-6 hour training class, online or in classroom)
TPSB Level 3 Commissioned Security (Armed) Training Course (by appointment/reservation only)General Course Description:
Laws Pertinent to the Security Officer
Field Notes and Report Writing
Crime Scenes
Awareness Skills
Use of Force
Conflict Resolution
Defensive Tactics
Handcuffing
Firearms
 Required Equipment:
For the classroom portion of your training, it is recommended that you bring a notebook or notepad with pen or pencil for note taking.

During the firearms range portion of the class, you are required to qualify with a handgun. The handgun must be at least a .38 caliber revolver or a 9mm semi automatic. Bring your handgun to the range (not to the classroom), 50 rounds of ammunition (you are responsible for purchasing your own ammo), hearing and eye protection for the range.
**Please note that if you qualify with a revolver, while on duty as a Security Officer, you will only be allowed to carry a revolver. If you qualify with a semi automatic, while on duty working as a Security Officer, you will only be allowed to carry a semi automatic .9mm or .40 caliber. **

Price:
$180 (Level II and Level III)
State Pre-Qualifications:
Those interested in joining the security industry should be aware of the DPS criminal background disqualifications (free of convictions that are felonies under 10 years, convictions that are Class A and Class B misdemeanors in the last five years), more information is available online in the PSB section on the DPS homepage.
Future Opportunities with Med-Security, Inc. Though we proudly employ many of our graduates (once an active license has been issued by DPS) we DO NOT GUARANTEE placement. For more information, please call us at (210) 314-1850 or respond through our ad. We look forward to hearing from you!

Med-Security, Inc. is approved and fully licensed by the Texas Department of Public Safety-Regulatory Services Division Private Security Bureau (PSB).

They range from a Captain or Mate in the wheelhouse, Bosun or Deckhand on deck, Chief Engineers in the Engine room, Chief Steward and Assistant Cooks in the Galley, Supervisors and Foremen in the factory.Our entry level positions are our Processors who work many areas within our factories. All positions play an important role in the success of this company.¬†WATCH A PROCESSING VIDEO:¬†https://youtu.be/r663de4O7zc¬†65 day contract¬†16 hour shift, 7 days a week¬† ¬†Compensation is a crew share¬†Species include Yellowfin, Alaska Plaice, Cod, Rex Sole, Rock Sole and othersMUST PASS DRUG TEST AND CRIMINAL BACKGROUND CHECKHow does the pay work?Crew members are paid a crew share rate for each trip completed. Entry level earnings can range from $3000 - $3600 per trip. A single trip takes approximately 21-25 days to complete. Crew can expect to work about 3 trips on average in a 65 day contract.¬†*Please note pay estimates are based on averages. Company covers cost of flight from Seattle to Alaska. *Apply online at: https://glacierfish.applicantpro.com/jobs/858030.html¬†THIS POSITION IS A GOOD FIT FOR THOSE WITH EXPERIENCE IN LABOR INTENSIVE JOBS!(Oil Rig Workers, Construction, Farmer, Miners, Firefighters, Derekhand)Glacier Fish is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is proud of our diverse and talented crew and considers them to be our greatest asset. ¬†We take pride in the fact that many of our crew members have been with the company 20 years or more.Glacier Fish Company provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Job Title: Truck Driver - CDL Class A - Earn $65K Annually - Penske Logistics
Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


What‚Äôs the Job?Ready to put your truck-driving career in high gear? Make the shift and fuel your career as a CDL Class A Truck Driver for Penske. When you join Penske, you join a team of professional truck drivers committed to delivering products safely and on time. And we‚Äôre proud to haul freight for some of the world‚Äôs leading brands. (Yes, we‚Äôre more than just the yellow trucks.)
But it‚Äôs more than that. It‚Äôs about incredible customer service and building relationships with your accounts. When you drive for Penske, you‚Äôre representing Penske, but you‚Äôre also representing your clients. In fact, you‚Äôll probably be driving their branded trucks and wearing their uniform.
You‚Äôll be on the move with Penske‚Äîand so will your career. We have tons of training opportunities for you. And with locations across the nation, you can also move to a new city.
Best of all, you‚Äôll be with a stable, nationwide company that is known for having the best equipment, great management, clear communication and a fantastic safety record. We pay every Friday, and for most of our driving positions, you‚Äôre home daily. Yes, daily. Are you ready to take it to the next level? Come drive for Penske.
The Specifics:‚Ä¢ Route/activity: Truck drivers are responsible for delivering parts to customers.‚Ä¢ Shift: Monday-Friday, 11:45pm-9:30am‚Ä¢ Equipment: Day cabs, 53‚Äô dry van trailers, manual pallet jacks‚Ä¢ Compensation: $25 per hour based on route spec. Average earnings of $65K annually!
Main Responsibilities:‚Ä¢ Driving your assigned truck safely and responsibly‚Ä¢ Following all federal and/or state laws, regulations, and/or agency rules, standards and guidelines‚Ä¢ Reporting problems with your truck, as well as accidents, traffic violations, and damage before and after route‚Ä¢ Acting as the main point of contact with your customer
Why Penske is for You:‚Ä¢ Outstanding company safety record‚Ä¢ Premier Driver Recognition Program‚Ä¢ Home daily for most positions‚Ä¢ Competitive starting salary‚Ä¢ Career stability‚Ä¢ Opportunity for growth‚Ä¢ Excellent benefits, including lots of time off‚Ä¢ Superior trucks and 24/7 roadside support‚Ä¢ Dedicated accounts‚Ä¢ Lots of training opportunities
Qualifications:‚Ä¢ CDL Class A required‚Ä¢ Currently hold, or ability to obtain, a non-excepted interstate DOT medical card required‚Ä¢ 1 year of documented tractor-trailer experience in the last 3 years required, or 2 years of documented tractor-trailer experience in the last 5 years‚Ä¢ 3 years DMV/MVR record with two or fewer moving violations or accidents‚Ä¢ Reliable‚Ä¢ Excellent customer service skills‚Ä¢ Focused on safety‚Ä¢ Regular, predictable, full attendance is an essential function of the job‚Ä¢ Willingness to travel as necessary, work the required schedule, work at the specific location required, complete Penske employment application, submit to a background investigation (to include past employment, education, and criminal history) and drug screening required.
This position is regulated by the Department of Transportation or designated as safety sensitive by the company, and the ability to work in a constant state of alertness and in a safe manner is required. Associates must have the ability to accept responsibility for their own safety, as well as the safety of others.
Physical Requirements:‚Ä¢ The physical and mental demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an associate to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.‚Ä¢ The associate must be able to see and hear. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.‚Ä¢ While performing the duties of this job, the associate will be required to move frequently, stand, walk, and sit. The associate is frequently required to use hands to touch, handle, and feel, and to reach with hands and arms. The associate must be able to regularly lift and/or move up to 50lbs/23kg and occasionally lift and/or move up to 100lbs/45kg.‚Ä¢ The associate must be able to legally operate a motor vehicle and safely and frequently enter/exit the vehicle as well as the rear cargo area.
Penske is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
About Penske LogisticsPenske Logistics is a wholly owned subsidiary of Penske Truck Leasing. With operations in North America, South America, Europe and Asia, Penske Logistics provides supply chain management and logistics services to leading companies around the world. Penske Logistics delivers value through its design, planning and execution in transportation, warehousing and freight management. Visit www.PenskeLogistics.com to learn more.

Job Title: Woodshed Houston--Chef de Cuisine & Sous Chef
Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


JOB OVERVIEW:

Chef de Cuisine--  The Chef de Cuisine will be responsible for the daily operations of the kitchen and all kitchen personnel. This demanding and often stressful position requires strong managerial, organization, communication, and leadership skills.

Day to day responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
‚Ä¢ Creating menus and overseeing the preparation of selected recipes
‚Ä¢ Manage and schedule all kitchen personnel
‚Ä¢ Track and maintain food and supply inventory
‚Ä¢ Place and receive orders
‚Ä¢ Monitor equipment maintenance
‚Ä¢ Insure kitchen and all personnel operate under local and state health and safety codes at all times

In this important leadership role, the Chef de Cuisine will be responsible for leading the kitchen staff, directing the cooking process, and monitoring the line at all times. He/she must have demonstrated ability to supervise, coordinate, and develop staff and resources in a time sensitive environment.



Sous Chef--


Collaborate with the chef de cuisine to create / perpetuate a positive learning environment. Work with culinary team to ensure that recipes are being consistently followed. Sanitation and uniform standards are being upheld and all SOP's are being adhered to. Manage Labor proactively by scheduling to forecast, creating prep lists per shift and monitoring all hourly employees, cutting when possible.

REPORTS TO:
Chef de Cuisine

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:
1. Collaborate with chef de cuisine to promote and uphold culinary standards.
2. Provide guidance to the kitchen team to achieve a consistent culture that represents our brand and vision appropriately.
3. Create a positive teaching environment encouraging the team to take ownership of the position the hold, learn and aspire to do better each and every day.
4. Lead and direct the team firmly and fairly applying constant, gentle, pressure to hold standards while directing the overall operation, ensuring proficiency and productivity.
5. Coach, mentor and train the team in accordance with our Standards, Sanitation and Food & Beverage specifications.
6. Schedule Labor and Control COGS proactively to ensure the best experience for our guests and associates while being fiscally responsible.
7. Ensure the team has all the information, products and tools necessary to be successful.
8. Manage the operations as required to ensure compliance with SOPs, safety regulations and federal, state and local regulations to ensure an optimal level of service, quality and hospitality are provided to the guest(s).
9. Abide by all State, Federal and Corporate requirements pertaining to serving alcoholic beverages.
10. Monitor and control the maintenance/sanitation of the various outlet areas and equipment to protect the assets, comply with policies and procedures and ensure quality service.
11. Comply with attendance rules and be available to work on a regular basis.
12. Perform any other job-related duties as assigned.

REQUIRED SKILLS AND ABILITIES:
Must have the ability to communicate in English. Ability to move throughout all food and beverage areas and continuously perform essential job functions. Ability to access and accurately input information using a moderately complex computer system. Ability to observe and distinguish product quality by smell, taste, and appearance.
Must possess a current Texas Food Handlers permit.

 For immediate consideration, please forward your resume to the link provided.

Job Title: Remote Work From Home - Moving Sales - $2,000 Per Week
Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Remote Work From Home - Moving Sales - $2,000 Per Week 

We are in search of experienced one call closers -  no moving experience req.  

We have been in business for many many years, with sales reps who¬†have been working with us since day one, earning an amazing¬†income...

all while working from home. 

We are not brokers...

We are the actual Carrier! 

We generate enough leads on a daily basis to keep you on the phone, closing deals. 

Having qualified leads to speak to will never be an issue. 

This is a 1099 position, meaning that you are your own boss. 

The only cost to working with us is having your own internet connection, headset and a computer, other than that...

We provide everything else, including:

* Newly Generated Leads (we spend thousands of dollars per day on leads for you to close)

* Live Transfers 

* Training & Support

* Floor Managers who will jump on a call to help you close a deal (and you keep all the commission)

* Available work schedule from 8:00 am to midnight, Monday - Sunday, choose what hours you want to work, as long as its Full Time.

* Top commission, so you can earn amazing income while working from home. 

* We are an A rated carrier - this alone is one of the big selling points, as customers want to have a sense of trust and security with who they are entrusting their household¬†items to 

What we are looking for: 

* Someone that can work Full-Time. At the end of each week, you submit your work schedule for the following week, so you get to set your own hours. We just need to know what days and hours you intend on working so we can have enough leads for you to speak with. 

* Someone with one call closing experience. We are not looking for someone that sold girl scout cookies at a kiosk in Walmart. We need actual CLOSERS, who can pull credit cards on the first call and close the deal. 

* A Hardcore closer. In this business, you eat what you kill. No sales equals no paycheck. You CAN NOT be scared of asking for the order and closing the deal. 

Think about this... there are thousands of people moving across the country..literally thousands of them. Either due to job transfers or change of life events. 

These people/families hire moving companies to move their stuff. 

We offer a service that they need and want... all we need you to do is pick up the phone and close the deals.. they are there waiting for you to call. 

Here is the next step. 

Please note, we normally get 100s of applications from sales reps per week to work for our company.. most of which are not qualified and basically are tire kickers. 

We are not looking to waste our time, we are only looking for closers that want to earn a MBA (Massive Bank Account) and are willing to work hard. 

We need to differentiate these real closers from those who are going to waste our time. 
In the next step we are going to ask you some questions and ask you to leave us a voicemail to a number that we provide.

DO NOT half answer these questions on the application, actually give detailed answers related to your background... and make sure to complete step 2, which is leaving a voicemail. 

Next Steps

Go to http://MovingSalesFromHome.com/ To Start the Process

compensation: commission

Job Description:
Our oil and gas client is looking for a freelance Digital Marketing Specialist to join their team on an ongoing basis. This is a 40-hour a week, offsite, freelance role that has the potential to turn salary.

The Digital Marketing Specialist will be supporting the upcoming launch of three new products by:
+ Creating fresh content for the company's social media platforms and manage the pages
+ Writing website, webinar, newsletter and blog content to help increase engagement
+ Presenting metrics
+ Supporting the efforts for company's website redesign project, working with the third-party vendor and internal teams
+ Managing website content
+ Helping to plan webinars

The ideal candidate is someone who understands digital metrics and knows how to translate them back to the sales team, as well as has tech or oil & gas industry experience.

+ Previous experience in a similar role
+ Industry experience (oil & gas and/or technology)

+ Ability to communicate the company's tone across the various social platforms

+ Strong communications and presentation skills

Job Title: Rare Coin Co. Seeks Fin. Advisors, Accountants and Expert Telmarkters
Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Hi my name is Jim Garofalo and I am the President of Professional Coin Galleries. If there were ever a time to sell 
Gold/Silver Rare Coins over the phone to collectors and investors it's NOW!! As of this posting( 2/2/21 ) Gold is $1840 an ounce and Silver is $$28.99 an ounce today. I am an Original Member of Stratton Oakmont. ( The Wolf of Wall Street ) I worked for that firm from 1989-1996, and I would work there a 100 times over again. What I learned there as a young kid out of college was work ethic and how to put my head down and grind it out over the phone! Ladies and Gentleman when it comes to training salespeople to sell Numismatic graded coins over the telephone from home I am hands down #1 in the country. I opened the doors to this company in 2009 and in almost 13 years we have NEVER done the business that we are doing now. 2020 in a pandemic we did $9,400,000.00 in sales. What I have instituted from the very beginng is that we bring a Wall Street mentality to the coin industry. 

Gold, Silver, Platinum and Palladium are at historic record level's that the world has never seen before, and looks to be going much much higher. We believe and many experts alike that the precious metals have a least a 5 year bull run ahead of us. Warren Buffet the most successful investor in our lifetime recently invested a half a billion dollars into physical Gold and an obnoxious amount of Silver. Funny thing is in all his years he has NEVER invested in the precious metals. Thats got to tell you something. Now is the time! Not only for you, but for your clients to make a fortune. Not many times in life can you catch lighting in a bottle. The window is open!! The stock market is being held up by 10 stocks. Tree's grow to the sky, but eventually they stop! This is the time for the precious metals. 

We had to close our NYC office on 24th Street and Park Ave on March 19 due to Covet-19 and let to let 41 people go. 
We were in that space for 7 years. We also had to close our Boca Raton office. So at the end of April we decided to train salespeople via Zoom. We have had eight different one week classes since and I am extremely happy with the results of our sales teams that we have created through Zoom. We have also learned a lot since we have started these classes and the type of salespeople we are looking for in the new 2021 class. Expert Telemarketer?? Expert Financial Advisor?? You better be!! You will see that making $1000 a day is like shooting fish in a barrel. You will meet people like Tim, Randy, Peter, Tami that have been with us only 5 months that made over $200,000 each in that time period. 

Our next class starts on Monday February 8th at 10 am EST. The class will go for 7 days Monday-Friday then on Monday and Tuesday. On Tuesday your last class we will get you on the phones. In order to be successful you need the full 7 days. Classes will run aprox 3 hours a day. I make them fun and they will go quick. We will give you major support and provide you with all the leads of coin collectors and investors that have purchased coins in the past. We pay 35% commission of the profit of the sale. ( Highest paid commission in the Nation ) We pay once a week on a 1099. I charge you nothing for the training, but I could certainly market the training and ask people to pay for it, it's that good! This is a real Job! Expect to work 8-10 hours a day. We have the data. If you make 300 dials a day you will be on your way to making $300,000+ in 2021. We have a A+ rating withe the Better Business Bureau and we are Accredited with the BBB. After 13 years we are pretty proud of that rating. Go to our website pcgalleries.com. and check it out. If you don't have at least 5 years experience of serious telemarketing, please don't apply. If you meet the qualifications for the position call me at 516-369-0523 and ill see if I can get you into the upcoming class on February 8th. If you work really hard I promise you that you will never forget me. ill never let you down! JG
