Full Job Description
Join #TeamROCO and earn a $1,000 sign-on bonus! We are looking for top talent to join our growing team ‚Äì in addition to our incredible total rewards package, including competitive earnings, 401(k) match, affordable quality healthcare and insurance plans, paid parental leave and so much more‚Ä¶you‚Äôll now be eligible for a $1,000 sign-on bonus. Our technicians and supervisors hired between 11/1/2020 - 12/31/2020 will earn $500 paid within your first pay cycle, and then another $500 paid after 90 days of employment. As a bonus, our employees are also eligible for a referral bonus ‚Äì so tell us who sent you! We can‚Äôt wait to welcome you to our team, #TeamROCO.


About ROCO:

Founded in 2012, ROCO Real Estate is a privately owned and operated full service real estate investment and management company headquartered in Bloomfield Hills, MI. ROCO currently owns approximately 10,000 apartment units across 12 states and has over 300 employees. ROCO has a long-term hold strategy for our assets, which means that when we invest in real estate we are making a meaningful commitment. We have experienced record growth due to hiring the best professionals in the industry. ROCO makes significant investments in our employees and properties. We treat our residents and Investor partners the way we would want to be treated, if our positions were reversed.

We are defined by our unique culture ‚Äì centered around young entrepreneurs making waves in an old industry. ROCO‚Äôs greatest asset, and the key to our success, is our people. We focus on customer-service and reward impact.


About this position:

Directly responsible to the Property Manager regarding all day to day maintenance for the property. The Maintenance Supervisor is the coordinator and supervisor of the maintenance program and project maintenance personnel. This is a "hands-on" position, which requires significant technical knowledge and skills. The maintenance supervisor reports to the Property Manager.


Responsibilities:

Prioritize and delegate work assignments and work orders and establish work schedules for maintenance, grounds and cleaning staff.
Ensures budget compliance for all maintenance related items.
Coordinate emergency maintenance on-call schedule, and post and distribute emergency telephone numbers.
Communicate with the Property Manager regularly regarding maintenance problems, status of large jobs and when needed collecting bids for the outsourcing
Coordinate unit turn-over procedures and closely track vacancies in order to assure minimal downtime and maximum quality.
In conjunction with the Regional Facilities Manager, oversee capital improvement schedule, and implement and adhere to weekly and monthly inspection schedule regarding common areas, roofs, community rooms, emergency lighting, safety and fire prevention equipment, security devices, boiler rooms, etc. Inspection reports should be submitted to the Property Manager on a regular basis.
Maintain neat, well organized shop with a 30-day inventory and inventory controls and make management-approved purchases of supplies, equipment and services.
Supervise, review, evaluate and counsel employees in conjunction with the directives of the Property Manager
Effectively service resident community by cooperating with residents, completing work orders in a timely, unobtrusive and courteous manner, and assuring that all maintenance and cleaning staff perform their functions in the same manner.
Ensure that maintenance personnel understand and comply with Worker's Compensation and OSHA safety rules.
Make certain that maintenance personnel understand and adhere to all Fair Housing Laws.
Carry out any and all duties assigned by supervisor(s) in carrying out the day to day responsibilities of managing and maintaining a multi-family property.

Requirements:

High school diploma or equivalent
3+ years‚Äô experience in multi-family residential property management
Knowledge and expertise of the Fair Housing laws and guidelines. Experience applying local state laws relative to Fair Housing.
Must be able to lift and carry at least 50 pounds and negotiate stairs and ladders easily.
Demonstrate an ability to support and contribute to community team.
Demonstrate strong oral and written communication skills.
Neat, clean, professional at all times throughout the workday and/or whenever present at the community.
Comply with expectations as demonstrated in the employee handbook.
Demonstrate ability to diffuse and respond to customer concerns to avoid escalation of the problem.
Attendance is an imperative job function
HVAC Certification: Candidate must obtain their HVAC Certification through our employer-funded certification program within 60 days of hire, or must be HVAC certified upon hire.

ROCO is proud to provide its team members with:

Comprehensive benefits package including affordable Medical, Dental & Vision plan options and 401(k) with employer-matched contributions.
ROCO University delivers virtual, live and instructor-led training on topics relevant to the Property Management industry.
Generous paid time off, including vacation, sick and personal time off, as well as paid holidays.
Lucrative commission and bonus plans, dependent on position.
Paid parental leave, Tuition reimbursement, Charitable donation program, Referral bonuses, Employee recognition programs and MUCH more!

Job Description:Record Center Specialists have to kneel, squat, reach, and bend forward frequently throughout their shifts. Their primary tasks include the moving, arranging, lifting and loading of storage boxes, bins and totes. Boxes, bins and totes range in weight from 24lbs to over 100lbs. Employees move boxes manually and via hand carts.Protective footwear is required and shall meet ASTM F2413-11 ‚ÄúStandard Specification for Performance Requirements for Protective ( Safety) Toe Cap Footwear‚Äù and have a slip-resistant rating designated as ‚ÄúBetter or Best‚ÄùJob Summary/Work ScheduleNormal Work Schedule: 5 days a week, 9 hours a day including 30-minute lunch and two 15-minute breaks.Description of position and job requirements:Employees process orders and move boxes of files, books, binders, backup tapes and other materials. The work is very physical requiring the manual lifting, carrying, and moving/arranging of boxes while standing, stooping, crawling, kneeling and twisting. Employees must be able to lift and carry boxes ranging in weight from 10-100lbs on a regular basis, without assistance. Employees must be able to load and safely operate hand trucks and pallet jacks while walking on uneven and concrete surfaces.Essential Functions:- Walk, stand, kneel, squat, stoop and bend for extended periods of time- Work without assistance in order to grip, lift, push, pull, and carry boxes including up and down inclines, stairs, and over changes in walking surface/elevation- Read and write English- Lift and move boxes, read labels, and process incoming and outgoing orders.- Use the proprietary computer system to track orders and determine the location of boxes- Operate hand held scanner- Climb and balance on ladders- Lift and carry boxes weighing up to 100 lbs. without assistance for prolonged periods- Employee must be able to load, operate and move hand carts, pallet jacks and various other material handling aids- Load and shrink wrap pallets at ground level, or on carts- Load boxes onto pallets and load pallets onto trucks manually and with material handling aidsPosition Comments:

Flatbed Company Driver Jobs: Oilfield Lanes - Earn Up to $70,000  
Jobs Filling Fast! 800-880-5669or Click Here to Apply online today.


Welcome to J. H. Walker Trucking, a family-owned and operated company. Our DRIVERS are our most valued asset. Here you are a name not just a number.

We've grown at an incredible pace and need to bring on high quality flatbed drivers who are ready to make some money! We have picked up new MULTIMILLION DOLLAR contracts across the Gulf Coast. QR Code Link to This Post


Apply at https://thegroundup.com/careers

Founded in 2010, The Ground Up (TGU) is Houston‚Äôs fastest growing landscape supply company. We manufacture mulches & soils and carry a large selection of base, gravels, and sand products. TGU also operates three re-wholesale nurseries in the Houston Metro Area.

Job Summary:

The Equipment and Service Operator supports day-to-day operations of an assigned work site that services wholesale customers with bulk purchases. The ideal candidate is skilled in safely and efficiently operating heavy equipment in a busy and sometimes congested worksite, while never compromising the quality of work. We seek a positive team player who is reliable, flexible, organized, and detail-oriented, who can consistently deliver excellent customer service.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Comply with the proper operation and maintenance of assigned equipment
Perform a daily equipment walk-around inspection and maintain preventive maintenance
Operate equipment for 8+ hours per day, year-round in all types of weather and ground conditions
Perform other job-related duties such as general housekeeping of machine, general lubrication of applicable components
Travel occasionally to different project sites within the Houston area
Gain in-depth knowledge of product line
Operate forklifts  in warehouse and off-road
Manage Inventory and quality control
Maintain a neat, clean and orderly work area
Ensure proper use of personal protection equipment at all times
Perform physical activities that require considerable use of your arms and legs and moving your whole body, such as climbing, lifting, balancing, walking, stooping, and handling of materials
Other duties as assigned or needed
Essential Requirements:

HS diploma or GED
Minimum 3 years of experience as an equipment operator
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Willing and available to work during all seasons of the year
Reliable transportation to get to and from worksites
Valid State issued driver's license
Desired Qualifications:

A good mechanical/ mathematical aptitude as well as a general understanding of hydraulics
Physical Demands:

While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms and climb or balance.  The employee is frequently required to stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl.  The employee is occasionally required to talk or hear and taste or smell. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.  Specific vision abilities required by this job include peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.



Work Environment:

While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly exposed to outside weather conditions. The employee is frequently exposed to wet and/or humid conditions and moving mechanical parts. The employee is occasionally exposed to fumes or airborne particles; toxic or caustic chemicals; risk of electrical shock and vibration. The noise level in the work environment is usually loud.

Benefits:

Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance, Life Insurance, Short & Long Term Disability, 401K

The Ground Up - Ceres Environmental is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, religion, disability status, or protected veteran status. E-Verify:

We comply with Federal law by verifying employment eligibility.
Other Job Attributes:
compensation: $14 per hour

employment type: full-time

Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Wedding PHOTOGRAPHER ASSISTANT

EVOKE is looking to hire 2 assistants to aid our Primary Wedding Photographers in posing, lighting, and guest management. If you are excited by the idea of working alongside a professional photographer, and would enjoy a wedding environment, this may be perfect for you.

There are a few key things that you MUST have. First, you must be an outgoing people person. Second, you must have proper wedding attire and very dependable transportation. Third, you must be willing to work weekends. (That‚Äôs when the weddings are!) Finally, a basic understanding of lighting, lens selection, posing, exposure, and composition is needed. 

This is a fun job and you will learn a lot about photography. The position pays $25hr during coverage and $12hr for training time. You will generally make a few hundred dollars per weekend. 

We are ready to hire now and you may start as soon as this weekend. 

Please know that working at weddings during COVID is risky. We work indoor reception halls and churches every weekend. Sometimes there can be a hundred+ guests. We do take all the precautions necessary‚Ä¶.but please know that you take this job at your own risk. :( 

To apply, please reply at length stating why you would be a good fit for the position. Please be as detailed as possible as you will need to stand out from the crowd. If you have experience, gear or a resume, please include that as well. We will be doing Zoom interviews this week! 

To learn more about EVOKE, check out our website: www.evokephoto.com

Thank you very much for reading this! 

Jay

Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


In-House T-Shirt Artist Position

‚Ä™A screen printing company, in business for 15 years, is seeking a knowledgeable Screen Printer to join our small team of experts. Successful candidates will have a passion for quality, be comfortable working independently and collaboratively in a team.‚Ä¨

Summary of  Duties and Responsibilities: The duties of Screen Operator include but are not limited to:
Responsible for setting up and operating an automatic screen printing station according to written and/or verbal instructions, established company procedures, safety, and quality guidelines. Capable of solving printing problems, and making print adjustments to maintain print quality, registration, color, and production speed. Has good understanding of inks, solvents, and can print line, halftone, and potentially four color process on aluminum by performing the following duties personally or through assistant personnel. 

ESSENTIAL DUTIES and RESPONSIBILITIES

Receives production order and job assignments from supervisor. Reads order to verify quantity to be run, overrun tolerance, color sequence, and background color.
Obtains substrate, screen, ink, squeegee, and related supplies needed to produce job.
Sets up press according to established company guidelines, safety, and job requirements.
Prints setup prints to check press setup, registration, ink viscosity and color.
Prints job maintaining optimum production speed and makes press adjustments to maintain print quality, registration, and color.
Solves printing problems.
Completes production run including overruns and production samples.
Completes production records.
Ensures proper cleanliness of press, work station, and immediate press area by returning unused ink to ink shelves, removing trash, rags, and extra material.
Notifies supervisor if machine needs repair or maintenance.  

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

This job has no supervisory responsibilities. Carries out and conducts him/herself in accordance with company policies, procedures, safety, and applicable laws.

Job Requirements

QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE 

Must have good judgment of color, design, and print quality.

LANGUAGE SKILLS

Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos. Ability to write simple correspondence. 

MATHMATICAL SKILLS

Ability to add, subtract, and multiply using whole numbers. 

REASONING ABILITY

Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed but uninvolved written or oral instructions. Ability to deal with problems involving a few concrete variables in standard situations.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand; walk; use hands to place parts; reach with hands and arms; talk and hear. The employee is occasionally required to sit, stoop, kneel, or crouch. The employee must regularly lift/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, and ability to adjust focus.

WORK ENVIRONMENT 

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly exposed to moving mechanical parts, fumes, chemicals, and heat. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate to loud.

Be part of an All-Star Team!! STAR PROTECTION AGENCY is seeking a Non-Commissioned Security Officer in the League City area to assume responsibility for guarding site premises and property. The Security Officers will, on a routine basis, inspect grounds to ensure security requirements are met. Controls and monitors access to building. May be required to enforce parking regulations and report fire and safety hazards. Completes Daily Activity Reports, including any situations to management. May be required to use electronic surveillance equipment.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Promotes positive public relations by offering courteous service to all tenants, visitors, and guests and responding to their requests.
Controls access to buildings and monitors activities of visitors.
Monitors and controls the building's life safety system and central security panel.
Assists in emergency situations (e.g., fire, evacuations, human crises).
Escalates more complex security issues to supervisors and managers.
Monitors building operations and tours properties periodically during scheduled shift.
Maintains daily logs and shift reports.
Adheres to Security Policies and Procedures manual.
Performs other duties as assigned.

SHIFTS AVAILABLE
Openings for Full-Time
Opportunity for Growth

REASONING ABILITY

Requires basic analytical skills.

OTHER REQUIREMENTS, SKILLS and/or ABILITIES
*Must have your own reliable transportation

Job Title: DAY TRADE OUR MONEY - CORP. FUND MANAGER - NO INCOME CAP
Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Are you coachable and teachable enough to qualify to Trade OUR money in the Financial Markets? We trade mainly Futures and Forex and we‚Äôll share with you why! WE take the risk and YOU keep 50% to 80% of the profits. We‚Äôre a 10 year old company with thousands of traders/members worldwide. You don‚Äôt punch a time clock with us! Many of our traders only trade 1 or 2 hours a day, on their schedule, in the comfort of their home or office.

We will show you our trading tools in action. Most importantly, we will allow you to TRY OUR TRADING TOOLS for a full 30 days, so you can experience it for yourself and qualify to trade our money!

Have you ever wanted to learn to day trade but,

1) You don‚Äôt know how to start

2) You lack the capital to invest

3) You thought trading was too risky

If so, you are certainly not alone. Most people cite these reasons for not attempting it.

We solved these issues by doing what NO ONE ELSE WOULD DO!

1) We will teach you, step-by-step, with an EXPERIENCED, SUCCESSFUL personal coach, trading with you and using our proprietary PREDICTIVE indicators. So, you will know exactly how to profitably trade with CONFIDENCE.

2) Once you are trained and qualified, we will FUND AN ACCOUNT FOR YOU WITH OUR COMPANY FUNDS, up to $100,000 over time based on performance, so the income potential is exceptional!

3) We take ALL the risk. Even so, when you are profitable, YOU keep 50% to 80% of the profits. If you lose money (and practically everyone loses some as they are learning), you lose OUR money (which, by the way, you NEVER have to pay back). Naturally, since we both are interested in your success, we work hard to ensure that you don‚Äôt lose money, but are consistently profitable. 

Some may ask ‚Äî ‚ÄúWhy would your company do this?‚Äù

The reasons are simple: We have been doing this for years and have trained 1,000‚Äôs of individuals, from a wide range of backgrounds, to trade our system. 

Finally, any experienced trader will tell you that one of the most critical aspects of trading is dealing with the FEAR and EMOTIONS of trading your own money, meaning, most traders can be successful ‚Äúpractice‚Äù trading (without real money) but, once they start trading with their own real money at risk, it‚Äôs a ‚Äúwhole different ball game‚Äù, which the vast majority of people cannot handle ‚Äî and they end up losing their money and quitting.

But, when they trade OUR money, the pressure is off and they can trade with much the same calmness and confidence as when they were practice trading. As they trade with our money, they keep most of the profits and we keep the lesser portion.

So, we have created a WIN-WIN scenario for everyone involved.

We have had great success with our traders, but we have LIMITED spots available.

Again, our traders come from virtually all backgrounds, so it really comes down to "first come -- first-placed".

Time is of the essence, so fill out the application and we will be in touch with you.

https://trydaytrading.com/careers-houston-finance/

This is not in any way an offer or solicitation for you to buy or sell any securities to or from us. All trading is done on dummy accounts to learn how to trade or done in the accounts of others who give you permission to make trades in their accounts, and not with your own money. We are not licensed to offer or purchase securities, and thus do not offer or solicit the sale or purchase of securities by you from us. This is not a get-rich-quick program or business opportunity. We provide training and trading tools. We make no promises that our training and tools will generate future income for students, and you may not make your investment back.

START YOUR EXCITING SAFETY CAREER TODAY!

AVAILABLE CLASSES:
BAYTOWN - FEBRUARY 9, 2021
CONTACT US TODAY! CALL: 1.833.484.4650
REGISTER ON - WWW.ITHINKSAFETYACADEMY.COM


Course Certifications Consist of:

OSHA 30hr Construction
Industry Outreach Training course is a comprehensive safety program designed for anyone involved in the construction industry. Specifically devised for safety directors, safety supervisors, foremen, and field supervisors; the program provides complete information on OSHA compliance issues

Certified Site Safety Management (CSSM)
Mid-Level Safety Management industry overview. This course will teach you mid-level safety principals, identifying unsafe acts and conditions; Behavioral Based Safety (BBS) and how to effectively manage an industrial project.

Risk Management
This course covers the risk management approach involving the identification and assessment of risks followed by the elimination of risks. Students will understand how to handle employees involved in the hazard identification and risk control process. This course will also cover how to develop programs to prevent accidents

Incident Investigation Root Cause
The Incident Investigation course focuses on utilizing systematic techniques to uncover the root cause of an incident or accident. Students will learn how to uncover the who, what, why, when and how of each incident, and how to analyze data to prevent injuries, property damage and financial losses.

Emergency Response Management (ERM)
This course will teach students how to respond to an emergency, what steps to take. How to manage the scene and render care until aid is provided.

CPR, First Aid, AED
This course will teach students how to respond to an emergency such as a heart attack, cardiac arrest, stroke, or choking may be saved if people at the scene have had the life saving skills and techniques training.

Our Program Offers Construction Site Visits:
We offer our students hands on training with real-time
site visits. Nothing better prepares you like on the
job training.

Get Trained How To:
‚Ä¢ Familiarize yourself with worksite environments.
‚Ä¢ Conduct site audits and inspections.
‚Ä¢ Identify at risk behaviors and unsafe conditions

Job Summary

The Irrigation Technician is responsible for working as a team member under the direct supervision of the Operations Manager or Irrigation Manager. The Irrigation Technician is responsible for executing irrigation inspection systems; in an efficient manner, promote worksite safety, providing excellent customer service, and exhibit pride and quality workmanship.

Job Requirements:

Must be able to work a 5-day schedule, may include weekends and holidays.
Must be able to show proof of legal authorization to work in the United States.
Highly motivated, self-driven, and detailed oriented.
Must be professional in appearance and actions.
Maintain good attendance record as well as good punctuality.
Understands and adheres to company/safety policies, proper lifting techniques, and heat stress.
Must be able to properly, efficiently, and safely work with irrigation hand tools, and gas powered equipment.
Must be able to identify watering needs of commonly used plants, trees and turf in the Austin area.
Knowledge of two-wire systems strongly preferred.
TX Landscape Irrigator or Irrigation Technicians License strongly preferred not required.
If driving for the company, must have and maintain a valid state issued driver‚Äôs license as well as clear driving record.
Duties and Responsibilities:

Attend training and safety meetings and apply the subject matter to day to day task.
Follow directions given by Account Manager.
Work as part of a team.
Always represent the company‚Äôs best interest, maintain the highest level of integrity and professionalism.
Identify, correct or report work hazards on job sites.
Must be able to safely inspect, perform preventative maintenance on small engine power equipment.
Execute lock out / tag out procedures on small equipment.
Properly excavate, back fill and compact trenches.
Cut and glue PVC pipe and fittings.
Run and connect irrigation wire.
Safely load and secure pipe and irrigation parts for transport in work vehicle.
Program, trouble shoot, repair, trace wires, on existing and new irrigation controllers and systems for commercial and residential accounts.
Repair drip hose and fittings, adjust nozzles and spray patterns on different types of sprinkler heads.
Maintain detailed records of irrigation maintenance activities, completed work orders, inventory and time sheets.
Manage budgeted man hours per job.
Communicate equipment, labor, material requests, and follow direction given by Account Manager.
Communicate and coordinate work with other trades on site.
Assist with accident and incident reports.
Identify utility line locations at job sites before digging
Perform other duties as assigned.
Benefits

Competitive salary based on experience with merit increases for exceptional job performance
401K
Commission available for any out of contract sales
Benefits package available (Health Insurance, Dental and Vision, and more)
Paid holidays
Paid vacation

Job Title: Earn $100,000+: a real solution to reopening restaurants
Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


About:
We are a startup looking to form partnerships with restaurant consultants who can help sign up restaurants for our 100% free service. Our founders are from Airbnb and Google. 

Cheqout is a free contactless mobile ordering and payments solution. It essentially turns every customer‚Äôs phone into a personal kiosk that sends orders and payments to restaurants‚Äô POS systems. We provide QR code placards to place on tables or outside restaurants. Customers pull out their phone camera, scan the code, and this opens the restaurant‚Äôs menu on our mobile website, where customers can order and pay. Cheqout is not an app, so it works with any phone. 

This means customers no longer have to touch a credit card reader, touch a menu, wait in line, or even wait for a waiter. They just scan the QR code (wherever you place it inside or outside the restaurant) and they can order and pay. 

Cheqout is 100% free for restaurants, and we can set it up at any restaurant in less than an hour.  

Our Referral Program:
We are offering to share profits 50/50 for 12 months for every restaurant you can help us sign up. 

To get started, please Apply Here.

Job Title: Maintenance Worker at Self Storage Facility
Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


This position is a full-time 40 hour a week position. Please apply online at https://www.sentry-selfstorage.com/careers and you may also email your resume. VALID DRIVERS LICENSE IS REQUIRED. This is a full-time floater position with 40 hours per week. Serious inquiries only.

The Maintenance Worker must possess entry-level knowledge on basic building maintenance and some trade support, i.e., basic electrical, plumbing, maintenance, masonry, custodial, carpentry, painting, doors, HVAC systems, gates, roofs, golf carts, etc. The position works under the direction of the Property Manager and the District Manager. It provides services for single or multiple locations within a District. Maintenance Workers, who work 30 or more standard hours weekly, are eligible for health insurance, life insurance, dental insurance, 401(k), paid vacations, holidays, and other generous benefits.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Custodial ‚Äì Approximately 50%

Ensures that company standards of cleanliness and appearance are met or exceeded in offices, restrooms, exterior areas, company units, hallways, etc.
Cleans vacated units on a timely basis (reviews units to ensure that doors, latches, and alarms are functional)
Inspects for pest control and takes appropriate actions
Ensures that the safe handling and storage of chemicals and cleaners used in performing duties is in compliance with safety standards
Maintenance ‚Äì Approximately 50%

Monitors the physical condition of the facility and reports maintenance requirements and potential equipment failures to the Store Manager
Performs minor nonstructural carpentry repairs and replacements on doors, fences, and buildings as required. May also do minor plumbing and electrical repairs not required to be performed by a licensed contractor
Performs preventive maintenance work on HVAC equipment, gates, etc.
Performs touch up painting and landscape maintenance on the property
Performs nonstructural unit conversions as directed
Other

Conducts daily travel to scheduled sites for various tasks as directed
Completes assigned tasks and meets quality, time, and financial constraints
Performs all work using safe work practices and in accordance with policies
Ensures the facility has sufficient supplies on hand to conduct job duties
A general knowledge of site management that includes customer service skills and daily operational knowledge is required.
Performs other duties as assigned; works with minimum direct supervision; operates effectively on a team
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES: This job has no supervisory responsibilities.

QUALIFICATIONS: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Sentry Self Storage seeks employees that have pro-active, ‚Äúcan-do‚Äù mentalities, positive attitudes, and operate with integrity. Employment with Sentry Self Storage is contingent on the successful completion of a background and drug screening. Employees must have a current driver‚Äôs license and must be able to travel to a number of properties.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE: A High School diploma/GED equivalent and three to six months of related experience and/or training are required. Certifications or trade cards helpful but not required.

LANGUAGE SKILLS: The Maintenance Worker must be able to read and interpret basic maintenance instructions, directions, government requirements, and labels in English and must possess the ability to write simple reports, use a computer, and present information to groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public in English.

REASONING ABILITY: Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form, and the ability to deal with problems, new challenges, and change is necessary.

WORK ENVIRONMENT: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly exposed to moving mechanical parts. The employee is frequently exposed to fumes or airborne particles, outside weather conditions, risk of electrical shock, and vibration. The employee is occasionally exposed to wet and/or humid conditions; high, precarious places; toxic or caustic chemicals; and explosives. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate but can occasionally be loud. Specific job duties affected by the environment include using a variety of power tools, moving machinery, and parts, elevator shafts, all duties associated with broad-based full maintenance of sites, etc.

General Facility Hours: Monday - Saturday 9:00 AM ‚Äì 6:00 PM and Sunday 10:00 AM ‚Äì 3:00 PM at most locations (generally two days off per week; not typically Saturday)

Maintain service call records and ensure the work orders are closed appropriately in the database system for billing purposes using smart phone, tablet, iPad, and/or computer.

Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Global Resources LLC is the largest full-service business development firm serving small to mid-sized businesses in the US. Through the coordinated efforts of corporate headquarters and field service personnel; Global Resources installs proven methods, systems, controls and incentives to enable business owners and their managers to maintain positive cash flow, control costs, and accelerate the growth of their companies.

As a Global Resources' Business Analyst, you will analyze small to medium-sized businesses; determine the financial impact of ownership decision-making, corporate structure, business planning and industry benchmarking. At the conclusion of the analysis, the Business Analyst and the client will decide if it makes sense to move into the implementation phase, utilizing the resources of our Consulting Services Division. Analysts are given the tools and trained in the skills necessary to accomplish this task. However, successful analysts have attributes that cannot be taught. They are strong, dynamic, confident teachers, communicators and leaders with exceptional understanding and empathy.

This position requires 10 years of executive, sales or business ownership experience, analytical skills and the ability to communicate effectively with business owners, senior management and boards of directors. Ideal candidates for this position are individuals who have previously owned their own businesses and/or have held upper management positions for a minimum of five years. A four-year degree is strongly preferred but we will consider candidates with strong business experience. 75%-90% travel, leaving on Sunday returning on Friday-home weekends. We are looking for candidates who are available within the next 30 days.

Global Resources offers a comprehensive training program; full benefits pkg. with 401k; this is not a salaried position-this is a fully commissioned employee position with the average first year in the low six figures and higher thereafter.

Please forward resume to Kerri Parks via our website: 
http://www.gr-us.com/careers/available-positions/senior-business-analyst/

Equal Opportunity Employer

Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


World Education-Who we are and What we do:
World Education is an online education curriculum provider that partners with colleges and universities all over the United States. WE provide online training courses, registration management services, marketing services, and career development services to our partnering schools and their enrolled students. Our curriculum is designed for continuing education students only and is not offered as credited material. WE offer both professional enrichment courses that train students in specific areas of an industry and career training programs that train students for specific career paths and include certification preparation when applicable.

What we are looking for...
We are looking for an experienced, expert Spanish/English bilingual Floral Designer to take our outline and write an online Floral Design eLearning program in Spanish. As an online education company, we have developed many courses and are looking for a candidate that can jump right in and write a fun, interactive, and engaging training program that will appeal to Spanish speaking professionals pursuing a career as a Floral Designer or looking to enhance their personal floral design skills. The right candidate will posses a master knowledge base in the field of floral design and be ready to teach the next generation of designers, they will posses extraordinary writing and communication skills in both English and Spanish, be able to complete tasks under tight deadlines and with little oversight, and work well within a designated budget.

Project Scope:
This project will consist of 4 individual courses in the following script structure:
-Introduction
-2-4 Lessons
--Each with at least 1 online activity to check knowledge
--Each with an end of lesson quiz
-Offline Study Assignment
-Final Exam

The expert will be responsible for writing and/or recording lectures, writing knowledge check activities and the assignments and assessments. The candidate will be provided the course and lesson outlines and be required to write out the lessons, activities, assignments, and assessments to make up a complete eLearning experience.

Project Objective:
Develop an online, self-paced training program that prepares Spanish speaking adult learners to pursue employment as a Floral Designer including obtaining the NCCB's national certification or start their own Florist business.

Audience:
Spanish speaking adults with little to no experience working in floral design who are looking to start a new career or design floral arrangements as a hobby.

compensation: $1,000.00

employment type: contract

Founded in 1957, we are a well established and honest Trucking Company and we need to grow. To do this we are getting brand new trucks. I have 1 more brand new Kenworth T-680 coming in. Non Haz: .50 to start. .52 after 60 days.
Haz Mat: .52 to start. .54 after 60 days. (A non Haz Driver can get their Haz at any time and switch to the Haz Rate)

All deadhead miles paid at that same rate. If you are a Haz Driver you get paid the Haz Rate even when hauling a non Haz load. We dont play games like that. Whatever your rate is is what you get at all times. Hourly Detention. Layover pay as needed. No touch. 

All our trucks have APU/Inverter/Fridge. 

-We also give a $200 bonus for any "No Violation Discovered" Inspection. (Limited to 1 per month)

-$500 added to your first check
-$500 after 3 months
-$500 after 6 months
-$500 after 9 months
-$500 after 12 months

-We offer Med, Vision, Dental.

This is a Dry Van position but if you also like Flat Bed work we could get you on some of our Flat Bed projects in the area as well. (Not required)

Orientation is usually 3 days. We pay the Travel, Hotel and $125 per day for Orientation.

We are based in AZ but our Drivers live all over the place. I have 3 other TX based Drivers right now.

Click HERE to Apply TODAY!


If you enjoy traveling to new states, meeting new people, supporting a dynamic team, and thriving in a fast-paced work environment, then being a C&S Traveling Selector is the ideal career opportunity for you. You will travel to different states across the country and support our warehouse facilities through a program rotation, with time home between rotations. Prior Selector/warehouse experience is preferred.

As a Selector, you will work individually selecting full-case grocery products from warehouse pick slots using a pallet jack or other equipment. You will either use order sheets or an audio headset. You will then fit the items on a pallet, shrink wrap the bundles, transport pallets to the shipping dock and in some cases, load them onto a trailer for delivering to customers. All of our employees are expected to make safety their top priority.


Job Description

Travel to different states across the country

Support a different C&S warehouse in each assignment rotation as a Warehouse Selector

Ensure accuracy of work and adherence to production and safety standards

Utilize necessary pick sheet or technology (e.g. voice, scanner) to select product.

Operate double walkie-rider or pallet jack to remove case(s) of product from storage rack and place on pallet and stick selection labels to the appropriate cases (not in all cases)

Move pallet on an electric pallet jack or walkie-rider until full or order is complete then transport pallets to shipping dock for delivery to retail stores.

Use proper wrapping techniques to ensure safety of product to prevent damage and inform supervisor of any differences in case quantity and/or description.

Perform other job-related duties as assigned

Prior Selector/warehouse experience preferred


Skills

Specialized Knowledge : Ability to operate pallet jack and other required materials handling equipment (MHE). Ability to operate pallet jack and other required materials handling equipment (MHE). Ability to operate battery hoist Compliance with all company policies and procedures.

Special Skills : To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed are representative of the knowledge, skills, ability and other characteristics required: Demonstrates commitment and ability to work safely. Show reliability and maintain satisfactory attendance. Produce quality work. Ability to maintain required productivity/work expectations.

Physical abilities: : Never balancing, sitting. Occasionally climbing up to 4 ft. (Must have fall protection training and using proper fall protection equipment). Occasionally smelling, crawling, kneeling, and talking. Occasionally, feeling, fingering, gripping and carrying up to 60 Lbs. Frequently lifting up to 60 Lbs. Continuously stooping, pivoting and reaching (level: Waist/overhead, etc.). Continuously standing and walking on surface type (s): Carpet, tile, concrete. continuously handling hearing, seeing and repetitive movement using both hands and feet.

Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Plastic Surgery Medical Assistant $20/hr. - Central West Houston - Aesthetics/Plastic Surgery/Dermatology

Very professional Aesthetics practice is seeking an experienced and highly qualified certified medical assistant. This position requires both clinical aptitude and the ability to act as a patient coordinator.

The clinical skills required for the job are as follows:

1). Medical Assistant Certification from a business or technical school
2). An absolute minimum of 3+ years as a medical assistant in private practice. Experience in Primary Care, Internal Medicine, Cardiology, Orthopedics, Obstetrics and Gyncology, Plastic Surgery or Dermatology is highly preferred.

The clinical assistant role of this position requires:
2). Experience as a medical assistant in a private practice where extensive competency and proficiency in setting up sterile fields for minor surgical procedures is required.
3). Assisting with post-surgical removal of sutures and staples and handling dressing changes 
4). Administering injections 
4). Rooming patients, taking vital signs, documenting patient information in Electronic Medical Records


The patient coordinator role for this position requires:

1). Experience handling patient education regarding procedures, that is instructing the patients in the procedural process as to how to prepare for the procedure, what to expect during the procedure and what is the anticipated recovery period
2). The ability to "sell" the procedure in such a way that the patient ultimately elects to schedule the surgery. 
3). The ability to procure patient consents and all pre-surgical paperwork and make certain any required laboratory tests are done prior to surgery
4). The ability to assist in surgical scheduling
5). Follow-up with potential patients for additional information which might result in the patient scheduling surgery
6). Shadowing the physician in the exam room and assisting with pre-operative and post-operative care
7). Follow up with patients post-surgical to determine patient satisfaction and healing
8). Ability to obtain referrals and network the practice to other potential patients

Additional attributes required are:
1). A very conservative, "natural",  front office appearance
2). Exceptional communication skills in English with an articulate communication style - that is excellent diction and grammar
3). Good job tenure
4). Excellent references
5). Clear criminal background check

This is an exceptional career opportunity in Plastic Surgery/Dermatology/Aesthetics with a very professional practice of credentialed, highly respected physicians. This practice is seeking a clinical professional who truly desires a long-term career with an established, successful practice in the field of Plastic Surgery/Aesthetics and Dermatology.

Beautiful offices, positive upbeat atmosphere, prime locations.  

Hours:
8:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. or 9:00 to 5:30 p.m. Monday through Thursday
8:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Friday 

Job location is Central West Houston with travel one day a week to Southwest Houston. 

In order to be considered for this position the following is absolutely required:
1). A current resume with contact information to include cell  number and e-mail address
2). A current photo
3). A cover letter
4). A minimum of (3) to (4) employer references

Moving & Logistics company in Southwest Houston looking for team members to help manage the day to day office activities. Part-time and Full-time positions available 7 days a week. We are looking for the following:

ROLE

This role plays an important part in the company. As a team member, you will focus on scheduling, following up with potential customers, acquiring new customers, and managing a positive service experience for our customers. You will be the voice of the company and often times our customer‚Äôs first experience with our company.

This role is responsible for generating and optimizing every opportunity the company gets to deliver a great service experience and meet company goals and expectations. Using ‚ÄúHumans Helping Humans‚Äù as a way of connecting with potential, existing, and returning customers, you will communicate the company‚Äôs benefits, services, products and details to potential and existing customers.

RESPONSIBILITIES

* Quote and schedule jobs to meet sales goals
* Outgoing calls & follow-ups for lead generation & nurturing to meet performance goals
* Answer incoming calls to assist callers with needs inquiries
* Have the ability to deescalate situations & be proactive
* Monitor & communicate with customers through phone, email, website & text
* Detail accuracy and quote confirmations to meet performance standards
* Job close-outs, review generation and billing accuracy
* Understand and excel at the Company‚Äôs standards and expectations

STRENGTHS

* Goal oriented
* Strong communication skills - verbal, written and listening
* Ability to build rapport with clients through phone, email & text
* Confident phone skills for outgoing & incoming calls
* Hustle mentality with the willingness to learn & grow
* Proactive with the ability to problem solve
* Multi-tasking is a must
* Punctual & dependable

SKILL REQUIREMENTS

* Sales experience or confidence to talk about company's services & products
* Ability to figure things out & learn quickly
* Skills to create customer relationships
* Excellent follow up skills
* An exceptional communicator
* Self-motivated and have the ability to work as a team
* Can manage time effectively and work efficiently
* Attention to detail and precision for accuracy
* QuickBooks online knowledge is a plus
* Bi-lingual is a plus

If you're looking to quickly grow with a company... then this is the job for you. Please email your resumes and include your phone number for a follow-up phone interview.

COVID-19 precautions
* Personal protective equipment provided or required
* Social distancing guidelines in place
* Sanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

Surrogacy is a rewarding experience for everyone involved. You don‚Äôt have to choose between surrogacy or a job. We admire your desire to give the most beautiful gift in the world to a family, while financially helping your own. 




"In my quest to fulfill my dream of helping a family through surrogacy I

was the first agency (I called several) tat I spoke with where I finally  
sensed "this is where I belong."



Your safety and happiness are our primary concern. A surrogacy journey is an emotional and complex medical process that can change lives and bring joy to all involved. Ages 20-37 years old

Live a healthy lifestyle (no drugs, smoking and healthy body weight)
Arizona, California, Colorado, DC, Delaware, Florida, Illinois, Maine, Maryland, New Hampshire, New Jersey, Nevada, Oregon, Texas, Rhode Island, South Carolina, Utah, Vermont,  or Washington Resident

The Sterile Compounding Pharmacy Technician is responsible for executing all processes in the production of compounded sterile preparations, while strictly adhering to current Good Manufacturing Practices (cGMP) and department‚Äôs Standard Operating Procedures (SOP).

Duties and Responsibilities 
‚Ä¢ Becomes trained in the entire sterile operation via internal training program
‚Ä¢ Performs high-risk sterile compounding in an ISO classified cGMP environment
‚Ä¢ Compounds sterile preparations accurately and in compliance with master formula worksheets
‚Ä¢ Performs compounding calculations and completes thorough documentation
‚Ä¢ Operates manufacturing equipment in order to deliver quality medication
‚Ä¢ Maintains an ISO classified environment through rigorous cleaning and disinfecting of the work area
‚Ä¢ Aids with sterilization of components used in the compounding process
‚Ä¢ Performs ancillary tasks and duties that support the compounding process such as, but not limited to, bubble point testing, inventory accounting, autoclaving, and LEAN manufacturing (5S, RCCM, GEMBA)
‚Ä¢ Utilizes aseptic technique when performing tasks within the clean room
‚Ä¢ Prepares work area and supplies thoroughly prior to compounding
‚Ä¢ Performs other duties and responsibilities within the department to ensure execution of the production schedule
‚Ä¢ Ensures cleansing and garbing is performed per company policy

Knowledge and Skills 
‚Ä¢ Detail-oriented and self-motivated

‚Ä¢ Communicate and collaborate effectively with a team to achieve goals around safety, quality, and delivery
‚Ä¢ Ability to carry out detailed written or oral instructions
‚Ä¢ Must be able to fully gown in aseptic garb for extended periods of time

‚Ä¢ Able to stand and walk for extended periods of time for consecutive days
‚Ä¢ Able to lift 25 pounds

Experience and Qualifications

‚Ä¢ Previous compounding experience, preferred

Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Casual Research Engineering Scientist Associate I
Petroleum Storage Tank (PST) & Public Water System (PWS) Investigator

LOCATION: Houston, TX

AGENCY: University of Texas Arlington
Division for Enterprise Development (Austin /Houston Office)


NUMBER OF POSITIONS: 6
PAY RATE: $25.00/ per hour
POSITION STATUS: CASUAL (HOURLY)

Skills test may be conducted during interview process. 

Job Summary: Conducts Petroleum Storage Tank (PST) and/or Public Water Systems (PWS) field investigations to determine compliance with 30 Texas Administrative Code (TAC) Chapter 334 and Chapter 290 using Texas Commission on Environmental quality (TCEQ) checklists with database entry. 

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
1.	Conducts pre-investigations - and leads technical inspections, surveys, follow-up investigations, and studies; determines PST and PWS facility compliance with 30 TAC Chapter 334 and Chapter 290;  prepares investigation reports.
2.	Completes required checklists and documentation for data entry of investigations into the TCEQ's compliance database, Consolidated Compliance and Enforcement Data System (CCEDS) within designated timeframes.
3.	Reviews files for data entry accuracy and makes necessary corrections. Performs quality control of work product to ensure that all investigation activities, technical assistance, and facility file construction and data entry are correct. 
4.	Communicates with clients, TCEQ staff and management and other affiliated parties via email, phone and written communication. Participates in meetings, conference calls, and work product evaluations as requested by the TCEQ.
5.	Serves as expert witness at TCEQ hearings.
6.	Performs other duties assigned.


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor's degree in Environmental Sciences, Natural Resources, Engineering, or related field with six months of work experience; or equivalent combination of education and relevant experience may be substituted as appropriate.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: One year experience in natural or physical science, engineering, environmental studies, environmental law, criminal justice, paralegal activities or related field, and one year experience in data analysis, environmental quality management, public utilities, business administration or a related field.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES: Solid working knowledge of the principles and methods of field investigation, basic rules of evidence, and Microsoft Word, Excel and TEAMS. Ability to learn and apply TCEQ and Environmental Protection Agency rules and regulations related to petroleum storage tanks and public water systems, including 30 TAC Chapter 334: Underground and Aboveground Storage Tanks, 30 TAC Chapter 290 Public Drinking Water, Texas Water Code, Chapter 26, and Code of Federal Regulations Title 40; and the use of TCEQ‚Äôs CCEDS, Permit and Registration Information System (PARIS); Secretary of State; UTA Petroleum Storage Tank Investigation System (PiTS), and Central Registry databases.

Skill in conducting inspections of both physical facilities and records; determining proper courses of action; performing basic data entry skills; managing time and assignments to meet deadlines; and operating a motor vehicle in a safe courteous manner in compliance with traffic laws.  

Ability to follow all applicable institutional standard operations and procedures, project related safety standards, and institutional paper and electronic file management requirements; learn, remember, and integrate complex concepts, difficult procedures, or complicated processes; communicate verbally with clients/customers to gather information &/or explain policies/procedures; routinely record information such as correspondence, reports, and other documents, conduct interviews and record information, prepare case narratives, or prepare other lengthy documents using handwritten or mechanical means; read with attention to details; hear and understand speech to interact with coworkers/clients/customers on a routine or frequent basis (with use of amplifying equipment/hearing aids, if necessary); work independently in home and remote offices; and work professionally and cooperatively in a team environment. 

WORKING CONDITIONS: Investigators work under a variety of conditions including but not limited to: outdoor activities such as working in and around the vicinity of gasoline dispensing facilities and public water systems; working around electrical hazards; working outdoors in a variety of weather conditions including extreme temperatures; standard indoor office conditions including repetitive use of a keyboard at a workstation. Work involves use of manual dexterity; sitting, standing, bending, lifting up to 50 pounds, walking, twisting, climbing, squatting, kneeling and crawling; routine travel (i.e. daily) statewide under extreme conditions such as all hours of day/night in high risk/dangerous setting or heavy travel for long distances to conduct investigations, etc. Must have own transportation and steel toe shoes to perform job duties.  

OTHER REQUIREMENTS: Specific job requirements or physical location of some positions allocated to this classification may render the position security sensitive, and thereby subject to the provisions of Chapter 552 Texas Government Code.

EEO Statement:
UTA is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action institution. Minorities, women, veterans and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply. Additionally, the University prohibits discrimination in employment on the basis of sexual orientation. A criminal background check will be conducted on finalists. The UTA is a tobacco free campus.

Please email resume and cover letter to CEEresumes@uta.edu. A skills test may be conducted during the interview process.
Other Job Attributes:
compensation: $25/ per hour

employment type: full-time

We are currently hiring Licensed Insurance Sales Agents with experience in selling Auto and Home products and a strong desire to help people. We are looking for someone who is confident, ambitious, has a strong work ethic, and someone who is coachable. We are seeking representatives from entry level to experienced professionals.
We offer swift advancement and management opportunities. We provide a generous training program. A program that guides you to continuous improvement in order to reach your personal goals and stay on course.. All of this in a culture of personal and professional enrichment. This is a company you can trust to build a future with.
Each week we mail thousands of letters to people who just bought or refinanced a home in the area. Our letter states that their mortgage can be paid off in the event of their death or make the mortgage payments in case of a disability or critical illness like cancer, heart attack or stroke. At the end of the term, if our clients outlive the policy, they receive all of their money back.
We offer the best products on the market. We specialize in mortgage protection, final expense, and retirement planning. Products with top A-rated companies that pay great commissions and long term financial growth.
The clients that are interested in our product will personally fill out our questionnaire (age, birth date, smoking status, best phone number and time to contact them) they will then mail the completed questionnaire back to us. *NO COLD CALLING*
Typically, commission on a mortgage protection product is about $600 per family you protect. Yes, it is full commission but our average full time underwriter will sell 4 to 5 mortgage protection plans a week.
You will need your life insurance license or be willing to get that license. We can assist with that process.
A part time agent is one who is willing to commit to a consistent part time schedule each week. Full time is 30+ hours per week.

Job Title: At Home Telesales ‚òéÔ∏è BEAUTIFUL COMMISSIONS üìû Everything's Provided
Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


THIS IS A WORK FROM HOME POSITION WHERE YOU'LL COLD CALL REAL ESTATE AGENTS WITH OUR ADVANCED INTERNET-BASED DIALING SYSTEM TO OFFER THEM A FREE 7 TRIAL OF OUR SERVICE... IT'S A VERY EASY SALE!

WHO IS PRESS LIKE?
Press Like is the number one platform helping modern real estate agents succeed on social media without having to do any of the work themselves. Even though some businesses are struggling through these tough times, interest rates just hit record lows, and the real estate industry across America is booming! Based on a recent study done by the National Association of Realtors, 74% of home buyers and sellers will look up Realtors social media presence before calling them to do business. So it is no longer a choice for them to have a unique social media presence to separate themselves from their competition; they need one! We are currently the industry leader trusted by the largest real estate brokerages on the planet. At Press Like, we may have a start-up vibe, but this is not our first rodeo. We've been in this space for eight years and serviced thousands of clients, and we are growing daily!

NOW HIRING
1099 work from home phone sales consultants to support our outstanding growth in the US market. Full-time sales positions will bring in on average $900-$1,900 per week. Part-time sales positions will make less depending on the hours that you put in. If you show promise, learn the structure, produce consistent sales, show leadership qualities, you could be put on a fast track to management and be trained how to help newer people get off to a great start. That is also a very lucrative position. The management team works around the clock to help with your success. You will have the opportunity to call Realtors Monday through Friday during their business hours. We have daily Zoom meetings on the weekdays where we roleplay with each other and share sales techniques to get better every day. There is a beautiful bonus structure, daily jackpots, along with weekly and monthly bonuses that reward consistency to ensure that you will always make a great living while growing along the way.

WHAT TO EXPECT
We have lots of training videos and scripts for you to go over before you start. There is live in-call coaching with lots of virtual meetings and role-playing to improve yourself daily. You log onto our system with a good internet connection and a headset with a microphone. Within 1 minute of logging in, a real estate agent with all of their information will connect to your headset. You read through the perfect script word for word, add your personality to be yourself, and build a tremendous human connection throughout the call. If you get stuck, don't worry, we are listening and will talk you through where to navigate and what to say, and the clients won't be able to hear us. If you want help on a call, and you are not sure if anyone is listening, then you use the walkie-talkie feature that everyone downloads on their phone, so we are just a push of the button away!

WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN OUR TEAM?
‚úì Great company with a service that real estate agents must have!
‚úì Endless income potential!
‚úì Weekly pay period!
‚úì No contract, commitment, or upfront cost for our clients to get started... Easy Sale! 
‚úì Stability - Almost every new person from last week made at least one sale on their first full day!
‚úì Flexibility - Work a full-time schedule in any time zone across the US! 
‚úì Training - You'll have the actual scripts that have brought us millions of dollars in sales! 
‚úì On-going daily development!
‚úì Access to six-figure top producers who are happy to help!
‚úì State of the art software!
‚úì Easy calling system with leads built-in!
‚úì The product dominates what our competition provides hands down!

WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR
‚Ä¢ One year of experience in direct sales, preferably over the phone! 
‚Ä¢ Someone not timid to ask for the sale with class and respect... Then ask again!
‚Ä¢ Highly motivated positive thinker, with a strong work ethic!
‚Ä¢ Success is an obligation!
‚Ä¢ Great phone presence with a pleasant vocal tonality!
‚Ä¢ Willing to implement a proven system with an open mind!
‚Ä¢ Can read a sales script perfectly like a paid actor or actress while thinking off the cuff!
‚Ä¢ Confident personality!

HOW TO APPLY:
2. Email us your resume.
3. Check for our email reply letting you know if you are invited to the interview.
4. If invited, join the Zoom meeting interview at 5:00 PM PST with the ID # we give you and possibly start as soon as Monday.

The seats are limited to how many people we can assist at once, so your resume submission timing will affect your opportunity to get started. Please take a look at our website http://www.presslike.com to see examples of the service we provide and watch a video of us in the Portland Oregon office Pre-COVID! Everyone works from home currently.

CDL A Frac Equipment Operator/Driver

We are seeking positive, motivated, hardworking employees to join our fleets to haul and operate equipment for hydraulic fracturing. We are seeking the right individuals who want to achieve, grow and lead. We attract and retain the best talent by investing in our employees and empowering them to develop themselves and their careers. Experience the challenges, rewards and opportunity of working for one the world‚Äôs largest providers of pressure pumping services to the oil and gas industry. By applying to our position, you will be joining a work environment where you will be excited about going to work every day!

**Please Call/Text the Hiring Manager's number attached to this ad (reference: CDL Oilfield Job) for immediate response**

POSITION: CDL A Hydraulic Fracturing Equipment Operator/Driver 
This frac position is responsible for driving, operating, and maintaining equipment.
The position will also be responsible for mentoring and assisting in training for coordinator and drivers/operators. 
Will drive and operate equipment for our customers on dedicated wells. 
Responsible for driving and operating heavy/complex trucks and equipment in/out the field.  
Will calculate and monitor ratios and lbs. to perform service. 
Individually performs, or instructs equipment operators, to adjust sand based on calculations.
Utilizes information gathered from calculations/ratios/or other factors in the field to adjust to situations and understands consequences to actions.

POSITION REQUIREMENTS: 
Must have a Class A CDL license and a current DOT medical card. 
Must have a minimum of two (2) years CDL driving experience.
Must be a minimum of twenty-three (23) years of age.
Must have experience with manual transmissions.
Must be able to drive truck off-road and on roads that are narrow and rough terrain. 
Must have good communication skills, bi-lingual is a huge plus (English/Spanish).
Must be able to effectively navigate a computer, cell phone and tablet. 
Basic knowledge of computer systems.

COMPENSATION:
Up to $2,500 per week earning potential.
All drivers are compensated weekly.
Holiday bonuses (every year).
Currently working on new appreciation bonus.
FREE HOUSING

SCHEDULE/HOURS: 
Employee can pick his/her own schedule.
2 weeks on, 1 week off.
3 weeks on, 1 week off.
Day and night schedules available. 

BENEFITS:
Healthcare provided: Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance.
Each employee has multiple Medical plans to choose from (depending on family needs).
Provided by company: Life Insurance, short-term/long-term disability.
Fuel card provided, discounts at the pump for food, drinks and store items.
Vacation: provided to drivers with supervisor approval.
401(k) Retirement: match will be back by 2021.
HOUSING: FREE HOUSING!!!!!

Job Title: Part Time Pharmaceutical Delivery Driver Needed!!
Job Description:
QR Code Link to This Post


We are hiring Part Time dedicated customer service driven professional delivery drivers with economical vehicles to help us pick up medications from multiple Randalls Pharmacy locations in the 45 South/Houston/Galveston area and deliver them to local patients in need.

There will be 1 pick-up time per day, per location Monday - Friday. 1pm pick-up and ALL stops MUST be delivered before 5pm. 

The majority of all deliveries will fall within 0-5 miles from each Randalls location. So miles driven will be fairly minimal once picked up from the store.

Please see the pay structure that will be paid to the drivers below:

0-7 miles from the pharmacy - $4 per stop
anything over 7 miles, the driver will be paid 0.80 cents per mile starting from the pick-up location.
In Addition, drivers will be paid $25 per day Mon-Fri, plus commission. So basically, a $125 weekly guarantee plus commission to cover this route. 

We are looking to hire and start the training process immediately!!

2 week processing period, then paid weekly. Weekly payments via Direct Deposit - Weekly Part Time pay between $200 to $400 plus per week. Pay Range Varies depending on Route and Number of daily stops.

When calling the ad, please say you are calling about the RANDALLS HOUSTON driver position.

We are looking for serious long term candidates only. We need someone who is dedicated, flexible with scheduling, responsible, professional, and money driven. When need someone that can deliver excellence and hospitality to every customer one package a a time! We are a national company with a strong foundation and we have been in business for over 16 years. To apply for the position, please call 832-963-2888. If no answer, please leave a voice mail with your detailed information and we will call you back. Please be able to meet the requirements below: Thank you!

REQUIREMENTS:

Professional Appearance
Slacks or khakis and Collared Shirts only
No shorts allowed
Self motivated
Punctual
Great positive attitude
Flexible with work hours
Pharmaceutical Delivery Experience a plus
Must have an ECONOMICAL VEHICLE (a minimum of 25 miles per gallon or preferably better)
Must have a GPS
MUST HAVE AN ANDROID or APPLE POWERED SMART PHONE - MANDATORY!!!
Must have great customer service skills
Must be responsible
Must be a team player
Must be courteous to our customers and to our patients
Must be able to pass a background check and drug test
Must have car insurance, drivers license, and social security card
Most importantly enjoy your job!!
